AgpY-zj6bv2C5quroFSfTg.text: Kids and I dropped by after we found it on yelp. We had a good experience. I found plenty of healthy choices. My hard to please children each found somthing they liked and ate on the kids menu. The wait staff was nice and helpful. Food was served promptly drinks were kept full. The clever name brought us in cu and we left happy and  satified. We will be back.

Y2bKka8eHprlIOffjVWFog.text: Poor service...I can't comment on the food because we didn't get any. My family and I sat there for almost 20 minutes and saw 3 servers pass by us numerous times without acknowledging our presence.  Meanwhile,  a group that was seated after us, was waited on.  We got up, told the hostess we were leaving because no one helped us and left. Awful! We won't go there again...we ended up at oreganos and were treated great.

pzjHs2TwBt3ANt-FF14StQ.text: This place is great ! Very knowledgeable and accommodating to my girlfriends celiacs disease . Our server Bryan was attentive without being annoying and all of our food and drinks were top notch !

NeFKMqb__VTw2OCEYzSyUw.text: Wonderful healthy place for lunch. Great for meetings or just to enjoy a break from the office.

8msah3M0tmYSjbxOJ_z5vQ.text: First time eating here, ordered a takeout meal and had "ciabatta" bread on the side. Worst ciabatta bread I've ever had. It was like paper, tissue paper. Jimmy John's uses nicer bread for their sandwiches. As for the pastas, they were okay, my boyfriend added chicken to his Mediterranean Mac n' Cheese and had to spit it out because it was too chewy. I had the butternut squash pasta and it was alright, wouldn't get it again. Portion size was huge, good for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

GYBvfyXeo2VEnSXi1AZ8gA.text: Service has always been great and the food is just as good! It's definitely a go to in AZ that has enough great choices to mix things up each time. Lots of great flavors!!!!

9uo6tOdmaTvMf98UR4EI-g.text: We split an outstanding pear and salmon salad. The dressing was light. I also had the tomoto basil soup. Fresh taste with chunks of tomato. Cute atmosphere.

v83Rw7gfCaQT4lOA4QACbQ.text: We've been here a few times,  and ordered different items.  Everything had been freshly made and delicious.  Generous portions.  Very nice selection,  good prices.

m-g7cuCquG7TVvPcN8Wyfg.text: This place has massive, delicious salads. One of our regular, go-to restaurants in Tempe.

x5hFpUtTA5XAD2zTrTyifw.text: Good food, good service & good wine. I have been here multiple times & u can't go wrong with it!

cvsa1bguHQhpG6h9n3t5Eg.text: Cute place, can work for either a low key date night or a casual lunch. Love the salad/pasta combo option!

eoA9UP77gecbP290yjN0Ug.text: The service is great and the food is delicious I would suggest this place to anyone. it's in a great location and I had the perfect grilled cheese it had the perfect comibination of sweet and salty and the peach cobbler is isn't to sweet and it isn't to bitter its a great desert.

1WZtuTP9P3JSdpRiTSF8BA.text: Wine and appetizer  Wine lite and refreshing. Appetizer not good - don't go with the goat cheese and olives. The crostini was like eating flour from a sack.

I88sxWFCY5oZany6NH-xqQ.text: Took our party of 14 immediately and did separate checks without adding the tip or a service fee. We were able to tip generously for the quality service and food.  Also, no extra charge for gluten free bread for the sandwiches! The food was delicious and well priced. It does get a little loud due to the small size and acoustics in the main room. Would definitely go back again

5G5q72vxD0DEnaTfFnSXKQ.text: Loved this restaurant! I eat wfpb and there were so many options it was difficult to choose. I ended up with 1/2 pasta  (rigatoni with butternut squash, no bacon)  and 1/2 salad (wild chop salad, no feta). I'm not totally sure how compliant the rigatoni was (could've had milk in the sauce) but it was all so completely yummy that I went home and started looking for similar recipes on Pinterest.  The meat eaters in my group raved about the food too. Excellent choice!

b3U89FGvno_McBfxnkv5kg.text: Atmosphere good Food under cooked and under seasoned (way under seasoned) Has a lot of potential but the kitchen needs some direction

XlNg39munJhiM-__2nXOjw.text: We came here for lunch. It was a last minute decision that we were excited about, a little mixed on my feelings though. I got a the buffalo chicken tacos...they were good, although I would order something else  next time. Boyfriend got the marbled Cuban, it was really good. Our service was rather slow and non-existent at time for a very long period of time. This sucked because we sat at the bar for the very reason of quick service. They were literally having a meeting behind the bar with a lady with a folder and a pen discussing their payroll right in front of us rather than attend to us and take our order. I know this is a small place but please, hold these meetings on the beautiful patio or before/after hours and pay attention to your patrons. With that being said, the food quality was good, the portions were good and that about sums it up.

TutD2udi1VezDIOySLhTbg.text: What a great find.  We were looking for a place to dine al fresco and found this lovely place.  They had lots of options with healthy choices to eat.  The food was tasty and we had great service.  I would definitely return.

DXiw4x6kweFMmizWkXotGA.text: Dinner with colleagues at a late hour was quite pleasant. The service was excellent and attentive. "Pear" has a wonderful variety of creative cocktails. The soup is superb - and though my friend and I had different soups, we both really enjoyed what we had. The pasta dishes are generous and tasty - and everyone enjoyed their dinner, ranging from several pasta dishes to grilled cheese to a large salad. We did not have a single complaint and will definitely be back!

pTX5ZN-S6RKW51dYY99ZjA.text: Okay so I love this place- the food is always great and our server Bryan was the best! BUT- I was here today and as soon as we walked in the host looked annoyed, and then we asked to sit inside and she said she didn't have anything inside available even though there were plenty of empty tables inside, and when she seated us outside she brought us to a table in the sun (its 95 degrees out) and I asked if we could sit in the shade and she was like "okay well is going to really mess up my rotation" and was super rude about it.

nawYWvYtfXehq8zw97ZqgA.text: Good food and unique. Lots of vegetarian options. Went with a group of girls and we each tried the others dishes. Would love for one of these to be located where I live. But until then, I'll make sure I eat here when I'm in town

nOl5e_MtcUcrdzBU1XzG3A.text: Had take out lunch today, ordered 1 bacon jalapeno grilled cheese and chicken club sandwich. Both sandwiches were very good but I do wish I went for a side salad instead of fries. I thought the fries weren't good at all, but I dont think they deserve any less stars since the sandwiches were amazing.

qGRhXRdB9-0S6USPtVDurw.text: I absolutely loved this place! A friend suggested it for dinner on a Wednesday and we arrived around 7:30 to a mostly empty restaurant, but it was full when we left! I had the butternut squash tacos with caramelized onions, quinoa, feta and a cream sauce because that just sounded so interesting they had to be amazing or terrible. They were amazing.  Absolutely order these! My friend got the Mediterranean salad and I had a few bites. It was fresh and interesting.  I can't wait to come back and sit on their cute patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside shot of the amazing butternut squash tacos. Order these!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Butternut Squash Tacos. Absolutely great and I&#39;m not a  vegetarian!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mediterranean Salad. Very good!

OSH73VzLLKtSp448xxZoUQ.text: My family and I stopped by the Perfect Pear on our way to an Elite Event and were a little pressed for time. I informed the staff and they were amazing. They took our order with eagerness and had our food on our table in I swear less than ten minutes.  I had the chicken club sandwich, my daughter had the Perfect Pear grilled cheese and my wife had a pasta dish (can't recall the name). My sandwich was great. So much so that my daughter forced me to share. I highly recommend it. My daughters grilled cheese was also very good. It had a sweet flavor I enjoyed but some may think different. My wife's pasta had spicy sausage and was ok but my daughters and I dishes were the winners. Overall, I was impressed with some very good food but even more impressive was the staff. They really went above and beyond. Great experience.

-TjWSVZzizBpeKHisksbjg.text: A tad pricey but the service and food makes it worth the trip. The waitress was friendly & informative. The bartender had a heavy hand  definitely going back next time we are in Tempe .

4AidEyTpt6ITq53e6I_OvA.text: Very good food with a casual atmosphere. The portion sizes are huge. You can eat here for lunch and take home food for dinner. They have very interesting menu options featuring lots of pear. The appetizer Tukee Pear Quesadilla was big enough to be an entree but very delicious. The Pear Cobb salad was very good. The marbled Cuban sandwich was good but the pork was just a bit dry. Service was very good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Olives and Roasted Red Peppers
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shishito Peppers

N34HzuWBTj8f40hHKRHAEg.text: Our favorite place. All the food is seriously amazing. From the soups, to the sweet potato fries. Atmosphere is lovely and service has always been on point.

iGkBXOdTPCZULqYlEnU8Lg.text: I've been wanting to try out Perfect Pear Bistro for a while, so I was excited when my friend agreed to give this place a try with me after it opened up in Tempe! It wasn't very busy when we went on a weeknight after work. They had some happy hour drink specials so we each ended up getting a Pear Cider to start off with. There were a few different food options on special as well, but we opted to order off the menu for dinner.  I ordered the Chicken Pesto sandwich with french fries and my friend ordered the 1/2 salad (Pear Cobb) and 1/2 pasta (Tuscan Rigatoni). The salad came out & looked really good. It was pretty large too for a half salad (completely missed the chance of snagging a photo)! My friend said the salad was good & the pasta was just okay. As far as my order goes, I thought the sandwich was okay. The ciabatta bread wasn't toasted which I wish it would've been and the chicken was a bit dry. I actually picked it all off so that was a miss for me, I wouldn't order it again.  There were quite a few interesting options on the menu though that I'd be willing to give this place another chance. For now though, three stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Pesto sandwich.

Tfsb2yjJftzjVGzWRY-3Fg.text: Not sure why but we expected better from this place. It was our first meal on our AZ trip and it was disappointing. The staff was very unfriendly and impatient with us especially when taking our orders. There were a lot of options on the menu but no one in our party was particularly happy with the food. The pasta was average and needed more flavor. The place itself was cute but that was pretty much it.

GoIJEp7ThZmE3qTvOsinnQ.text: My sister graduated high school recently and she wanted the perfect place to eat at! So we stopped in here before they closed and they were able to take us in! I ordered Spinach dip with chips and a chicken club sandwich which was amazing! The fries were way better than any fast food or other chain restaurant that I've tried!   As promised, I'd like to shout out Shauna's customer service! She sat us right away, had a positive attitude, and delivered the food quick! The chef cooked our food to perfection, we will definitely be back! Thank you for an excellent meal you guys!

bCZVm7wuktTPPWdZ-4sOQQ.text: Walked in to enjoy a nice relaxing lunch with a friend at 11:15am today. Only to be greeted by a unfriendly hostess with mostly empty tables on the patio. When we requested patio seating she offered us the one table in the direct sunlight. She was clearly annoyed with our request for a shadier table and told us "Well, pick whatever seat you want!"  Dishing up plenty of sass and attitude before we ever sit down is not a great way to welcome guests. She tossed the menus down on the table and yelled over her shoulder to another server "I don't have a server for this table pick whoever you want to serve them."   We left before we would be anymore of an inconvenience.

HzD-JCrS6UDQ8YFtMnIdOQ.text: **Vegetarian Friendly**  Great indoor and outdoor area. Also a great place for a large group. This place has such a flexible menu that everything can be made vegetarian. The have different soups each day, and usually at least one vegetarian one on the menu.   Tapas: Pesto Goat Cheese Crostini and Pear Pico de Gallo Perfect sized portions at excellent prices. The pico was a very different spin, but very refreshing.   Entree: Perfect Grilled Cheese The best grilled cheese sandwich I've had in the Tempe area. Try it for yourself!   The drinks are great too! Highly recommend the Pear Mule and Pomegranate Mojito.   PS: Happy Hour is 11-6 everyday at this location! The other locations are 2-6, so definitely maximize on this!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear Pico de Gallo (Happy Hour Tapa)
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pesto Goat Cheese Crostini (Happy Hour Tapa)
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Perfectly Grilled Cheese (no bacon)

rdsFzlpG5Gr_JnAqd0Qqsw.text: We visited the Perfect Pear Bistro on June 1 for an early dinner prior to seeing a play at ASU Gammage.  This place is a fantastic option if you have plans near ASU.  They offer free parking and it is very easy to get in, eat and be on your way.  We chose to eat inside due to the heat but their patio is large, covered and so beautiful.  We were greeted immediately by a friendly hostess and offered a table near a window.  Our server stopped by for initial drink orders without any delay.  They have a really wonderful selection of vegetarian options rather than the typical one or two menu items often seen in many places.  We ordered the buffalo cauliflower, carnitas tacos and the Paco's pear tacos along with sides of a broccoli salad.  Everything tasted amazing.....especially those little sides of broccoli salad!  (I may have licked the bowl, lol!).  Prices are reasonable and ongoing follow up service throughout the meal was attentive and just right for us.  Definitely stop by and support this awesome local business if you are in the Tempe area!!

61jzg0Yob5RNjnZt9-JMaQ.text: I'm giving more stars than I want to because the venue is cute. My friend had reserved a table for about eight the day before, but when our party arrived, there were a lot of confused looks from the waitresses, basically saying, "What reservation?" It took a lot longer for this situation to be remedied as well because one waitress would look to another waitress to handle the situation. We were also forced to sit outside, and it's not exactly the best time of year to be having a meal outside.   Finally, they pushed some tables together. I ordered the Jalapeno grilled cheese with sweet potato fries [~10], which was spicier than I thought it would be. The sweet potato fries were quite good! My friend's grilled cheese came out cold, but it took nearly forever to track down a server. They just wouldn't come to check up on us for the longest time.   Even though Perfect Pear had made a mistake, we weren't compensated in any way. Service was disorganized, rude, and inefficient.   The venue isn't ideal for large groups either. The tables are two-seaters and some are pushed together to seat four people.   I was actually really disappointed in my experience today because I quite liked the Ahwatukee location.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

gpMb30P-OHrObeVkJN9hHw.text: Cute hippy restaurant with a posh feel. If you are looking for a nice atmosphere, perfect pear probably makes the cut!  Food overall is okay. I probably wouldn't come back here for more unless I was in the mood for salad.   What I had:  Baja lime salad - Huge salad with quinoa, beans, cucumbers, onions and assorted greens. My favorite item here, the lime vinaigrette was delicious and had me wanting more!   Mediterranean mac n cheese - pesto cream mac with sun dried tomatoes and onions. I didn't really taste any cheese so that kind of bummed me out.   My boyfriend had a sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was dry and not very flavorful. The sweet potato fries are worth it however.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yummy baja lime salad
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sandwich with sweet potato fries
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mediterranean mac n cheese

OBO_8c5MrAHxZDDtPNn8Qw.text: Love this place. It's my go to when in Phoenix. The salads are amazing with options to add a meat to it as an extra cost (it's also delicious without adding something). Menu is creative giving options to get half salad half pasta, half past half soup or half soup half salad. Pear jalapeno margarita was delicious. Full size portions are shown below. Overall it's tasty food for a good price. Can't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

kV-NDJUqFioW3MPQzwCzzw.text: First time at Perfect Pear Bistro. Arrived at 4 PM on a Saturday and there were three other tables full. More filled up as we ate.   This cafe is close to the movie theater, which is great.   I ordered the Bacon and Jalapeno Grilled Cheese. The bread, nine-grain, was nicely grilled with Romano cheese on the outside and cream cheese on the inside (think jalapeno popper). The Sweet Potato Fries were equally nicely cooked. They were cut thin with a crinkle pattern, for extra crispness. Good seasoning as well. It was well thought out and creative: a really good mix of flavors.   My kids got a Quad City Melt with seasonal fruit (watermelon, feta and seeds) and a Chicken Marsala Sandwich with fries. Both were excellent combos, with savory 'shrooms and meats tucked inside the fresh bread.   Our service was spot on, knowing that we were catching a movie. She was efficient and effective.   I recommend PPB to anyone for a quality, creative meal with good service and many gluten free options.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. The drink menu.

nEZEfRrbTb4eAiRC_SVpfQ.text: First time dining experience here. Sunday evening and an early dinner before a trip to DBG. Food was delicious, hot and generous portions. I loved the green chili Mac and cheese!

n3iyyKY3vV9LFuW_4CysaQ.text: This place is PERFECT! 'Punny' arent I? Was a little confused where to go in for my first time, found the doorway followed by a cute sunny/shady patio depending on which mood you're going for or what time of the day you decide to stop in. This place is pup friendly, which to me is a BONUS especially for my little Stella. The ambience was very chill and low key when I went, it could be a girly brunch or a casual but romantic date night too. To my surprise, it was happy hour so yes that's a thing here! I ordered the Raspberry mojito which most definitely added to my refreshing bites. For tapas we got the pesto goat cheese which was great! At first I was a little disappointed because we only got three little crostini breads to dip it in, but since our waitress was awesome she was on top of the game and offered more for our extra dip to not go to waste! We also got the cauliflower nachos which were interesting! I would have never thought to combine these ingredients prior to ordering this! It was interesting at first but then grew on me and ended up being a nice light snack. Afterwards, we ordered the pulled pork sandwich was also did not fail me. The dishes here, in my opinion are very unique and fresh. I love the chill vibes to the place and that I can bring my pup. Definitely explore this little hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cute patio! Shady or sunny seating!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. More crostinis for our dip!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Someone say happy hour?

Z9Ih0lNXL2zF2Qcp3M9KDg.text: All of the salads here are delicious. I have never been disappointed when I've branched out and away from the Cobb. The staff is generally very friendly and attentive and the location in Tempe is adorable. I love this place because it's delicious without racking up the calorie count. I love this place and always recommend as a solid lunch spot.

Ccz-_V11zMeXzgLT1EuBGA.text: This is officially on the top of my list of post-theater restaurants! Service is lovely, and ambiance is pleasant. We had the carnitas tacos, which were seasoned perfectly and really tender, and the Mediterranean salad with grilled shrimp, also cooked & seasoned perfectly. The tacos were accompanied by black beans, and I couldn't stay out of them! For the salad, I chose the house green mix and I was so glad I did because the arugula made everything even better. Definitely going back!!!

Sqftx2V95i2MiYCY9F1tfg.text: The atmosphere was nice and food was delicious. The waiter was very good. However, I was not impressed by the owner's unappreciative attitude. He seemed to have cared less if you enjoyed yourself or cared you were even there. He seated me and ran my food out to me and was very unfriendly. He didn't even stay long enough to tell me to please enjoy my food or ask if he could get me anything else and didn't come back by to see how it was. I am a chef. I trained at Le Cordon Bleu and it is my dream to have this exact type of bistro. I would appreciate every person so much and be very attentive knowing Yelpers can make you or break you. He wasn't even cooking. He was just running the front of the house. For only being open two months I hope he reads this and improves his attitude. It's not all about the food. I really would like to see him and his wife succeed.

Q6AyZnX4ZRPvtXzCl4dmDA.text: Oh My goodness!!! This place has the most incredible, healthy delicious food. I've consistently ordered the grilled cheese which blows you away. Go Go GO Get yourself some!!

WDVRwl2eHSR9q9z4M6Z56g.text: Awesome restaurant. Went before performance at Gammage. Service was impeccable throughout the evening. Soup specials - tomato basil and mushroom Brie  were superb. Wraps were amazing - spicy southwest chicken was fixed to order. Servings were more than ample. Great price point. On tap red ale was smooth. Will do re runs to this fine place!

-zyPvGUFtcOvHF44BPsqKg.text: Love this little local place. Adorable patio. Friendly staff, food is really good. The salads are great, the grill cheeses super good, lots of variety. I've never had a bad meal here.

tzOP4cGghh9FhZjHQx02Lg.text: Very cool place.  We were road tripping and decided to stop in.  Their Pear Mule is delicious.  Also, definitely try their green chili queso.  I don't like spicy, but I LOVED the queso.

nkAPRTO14DoQl5xDr7ajqQ.text: Loved the menu; very interesting and creative combinations of ingredients and flavors.  Sat outside on the covered patio on a perfect day, and we tried a great salad, a mushroom-brie soup, and one of their famous loaded grilled cheese sandwiches.  All was delicious.  Highly recommend this for a casual, tasty experience.

g3ltfb00f4t5d_K-dlQP6g.text: Service is great! Food is good! As always! We ordered perfect pear salad, sandwich, with soup and sweet potato chips. Very good! Environment very nice!

JqGcDqjEUSzDIvDX09Eo_w.text: The service was fast and friendly. The food was fresh and delicious. And the price was right. This is a great new neighborhood restaurant. Happy hour craft beers for $3.50. I will be back often I'm sure.!

fLKJJOZooUGUnMS0GJRmow.text: Really enjoy coming here for lunch. The options are amazing and the food is constantly delicious. They have a variety of options that range from salads to sandwiches to pasta. My husband had the soup there the other day and a so loved it. Great place!!!!

XOEYMzugbwq9E402EIqijQ.text: My family and I have been coming here since it has open. Every time isn't always smooth but they do a great job trying to fix every situation...usually. Tonight we came to dinner, my son and husband. The drink I ordered tasted like cough syrup completely undrinkable, when I tried to order a beer they were out of the one I wanted and They couldn't get the tap to pour correctly on the second one I asked for. My husband ordered a pasta dish we order every time  we come. The sauce was straight water and it didn't look close to anything we have eaten before. I never send food back but tonight we did and instead of "remaking" it like we were told it would be all they did was drain the watery sauce and send it out again. My husband and I hardly ate our meal and took it to go just so we can throw it away. I don't like to complain because I always feel terrible but the staff couldn't even offer an apology. I paid a decent amount of money to not eat or drink a thing. We will not be back and I hope next time they can use this for customer service training. Thank you perfect pair for ruining our family dinner that we don't always get to enjoy.

uoXxgeDBBmoglvXgpeyRVQ.text: Maybe I ordered wrong but I wasnt impressed. The ambience is great, but they were playing EDM which didn't really go with the feel of the restaurant. I ordered the black and blue Brussels sprouts, marsala pasta with chicken, and kids quesadilla with fries for my son. When the appetizers came up, some guy who was helping getting food out to tables walked by and set some buffalo cauliflower (don't name of appetizer) and said something real fast and walked away before I could even tell him it wasn't ours. Less than a minute later my waitress comes with our right appetizer and I tell her about the mistake which she promptly removes. The brussel sprouts were cooked perfectly, but I felt like there was too much blue cheese so if I ever go back I'd ask for no cheese next time. My marsala pasta was extremely disappointing, while the sauce was reminiscent of a marsala dish, it was so watery and soupy, it didnt even stick to my pasta. My chicken was just ok, nothing amazing. I really love pasta so this was upsetting for me. My sons fries tasted better than the pasta. He seemed to enjoy his food. I highly doubt I would come back, I'm not sure why this place has such good reviews but I only stopped here because it was along the way to an errand I was running and had good reviews.

3G5ioVGFYMeXYUX93k3EXQ.text: We were starving when we landed at the airport and were lucky to find this cute place on yelp! Food was fresh and delicious! We had soup, salads, flatbread and blt and all were so good! They also have really good iced tea. It was our waiters first day but he was so friendly and gave us great service! Everything was excellent!!

2e0j3A_gExPAGu5L_2Tegg.text: Went for weekday lunch. Salads are their thing. Saw many huge beautiful salads coming out of kitchen that looked tasty. I got asparagus soup-rate it as meh- it was salty and just not springy. Husband got grilled cheese which was awesome. I did wrap with chicken. Would totally go back and recommend to friends.  Beer selection good. Service timing perfect. Easily could do a work lunch and get back on time.

B68bFEv9cHLOkXtuu1gfNA.text: This is not like the original on Priest.  The restaurant is super dark (the patio is actually brighter), our waitress was not friendly and rushed us out.  I also felt like they were not as family-friendly here, also no changing station in either restroom (for babies) and the food was not like their other restaurants.  My friend got a veggie sandwich that was soggy - yuck!

_b8E5QPd3fS4gy90mO9pRw.text: Delicious goodness is how I'd describe the food. So far the greekadilla and the buffalo chicken tacos were oooh so delicious. I admit at first I was a little skeptical with the Greekadilla, so I requested hot sauce...oh, but the burst of flavor with that zing of spice was oh so....omg!!!...the drinks...amazing!!!....and both times I visited, the service was superb!

MrzCZ3RWHJqjBlATkBc-Xw.text: I am amazed by this place! Everything on the menu looked fantastic! The portions are big and the food is mouth watering! The service is exceptional! I totally recommend this place!

6hj3-1qWt-QaGb2Be_txJQ.text: Very good. Stopped in got lunch and very happy. Bacon and jalapeno grilled cheese awesome and spicy. Sweet potato fries top notch.

hZ10SzWzC007j6jIpHhhzg.text: I had a 6 hour layover in Phoenix, and wanted to get out of the airport and have a nice dinner. After reading a bunch of reviews, I ended up here. I was seated at the bar because I was solo, but the food, the ambiance, and the price were wonderful! If I lived closer, I'd certainly be back!

LrjdTtc952ki_r9qxP5NNg.text: Beautiful patio, gorgeous interior, excellent food and service. Seriously everything on this menu looks delicious. I got the perfect pear classic salad and my boyfriend got the buffalo chicken tacos. Both meals were really good! Also the watermelon black tea is like no other tea I have had. I really enjoyed it. Definitely would recommend their amazing happy hour and tapas as well!

p-ZZMi8Q2jaRtmx-ezjY_Q.text: Yum, I love this place! The salads are huge! Many healthy options here. Peach lavender iced tea, pulled pork tacos, and house pear salad is great. Went twice in one week. Will be back! Just wish it was closer to home :) Check this one out of you want something delicious but healthy. Also very dog friendly!

9bCsX_BGloPG-YAsYfJbxQ.text: Beautiful spot with awesome food! The place is decorated wonderfully and everything on the menu looks wonderful. I had the half salad half pasta combo. I wanted the asparagus soup but they were out. The servers were very nice but slow and forgetful. They left the door open on a cold, rainy night so we were freezing but we enjoyed our food so much!

XEopibPZJoRUhmkU4Wm8rw.text: My boyfriend and I love coming here and we love the food... but tonight we came in for dinner and we weren't as pleased. I'm not sure if there was a different chef, but I always order the roasted sprout salad in a wrap but tonight it came out and there were no Brussel sprouts which is the reason I order it!! The wrap was also broken and was falling apart in my hand..... my boyfriend always orders the garden green quinoa bowl with chicken, and this time there was SO much oil.... it looked like a soup at the bottom of the bowl like there was probably 1/4 cup of oil at the bottom. We still love this place, but we were disappointed tonight.

j3NFMUW8mxfBXTwHtglMAw.text: One of my favorite restaurants for sandwiches. Well portioned, reasonably priced yummy sandwiches that treat you to an explosion of flavors! Been to 2 of their locations so far and came off wanting to go back each time. Great ambiance and courteous staff. Way to go!

sQOcJoH9xGHegYWVHocmGA.text: checked out the happy hour and awesome selection! 5$ wines 3$ beer and appetizers. I ordered a salad (forgot the name) but it was a big portion! Bacon in every bite. Refills right away. Could watch the sunset from our table. We'll be back!

P3a_8jLwxTs1IqXg1CUHpQ.text: The perfect pair is a great blend of chic and delicious. Green chili Mac was bomb as was my wife's perfect grilled cheese. We both got the pear mule and it was great! Our server Taylor was helpful and nice. The interior reminded us of our usual places in Portland. I highly recommend it.

19sYLA2TM4E-kNBjWGthfw.text: This was a cute spot. The best this was the pear mule! Sooo good  so refreshing.. really like the appetizers too.

u_FCfu4xNtCbLfNCbVfEpA.text: Excellent service.  Great food selection. More unique choices. Happy hour starts at 11am every day! Pretty covered patio.

3IMsQ4QGU_lfhBF_ZTO5nA.text: Excellent dining experience in a very cute atmosphere; nice patio as well.  I have eaten there twice and the food has been fresh and hot.  Our waiter was excellent; however (and this is the reason for 4 stars, not 5), the courses sort of ran into each other.  We weren't even halfway done with the appetizer when the soup was delivered.  Then we weren't' complete with the appetizer or soup when the entree came.  It was only mildly annoying and the server apologized profusely and blamed himself...wow...someone that actually takes accountability for something rather than blaming the kitchen.  Anyway...I will definitely be taking other friends to this restaurant and my tip for you that might try this place is to NOT miss the Hummus Nacho's as an appetizer.  I know it doesn't sound great...but it's a taste fiesta in your mouth and thus far, has been the best thing on the menu that I've tried.

Moc7fld8rZVufJyr_u85_Q.text: We went here last night to give it another go, and grab a few beers. The service was excellent and the food was great, with good prices as well. While there was still a mix up this time (wrong cheese in a wrap), the problem was promptly fixed- they even let us keep the mess up wrap and gave us extra fresh fries. We will definitely be coming back!

8Pu5L9v-wXE-Rgr1OMQlmw.text: I really like this place. A great happy hour! The food is intelligent and tasty! I will be coming back for more!

R19ilJXWW9mEb69_dEJAyw.text: I don't write reviews often but I felt like this place was deserving of one. My pasta dish was delicious! I got the butternut squash pasta and it was divine. I'm not a huge fan of Oregano's and it was refreshing to eat some great pasta for a fair price. It ended up being $12 and it was worth it because of the quality and portion size. I'm really excited to try more stuff here.

J_3-02bJ6t15z8rj4iqDIQ.text: The first few times were great, the nachos and the Sicilian sandwich are delightlful. However, the last experience wasn't the best. The waiter seemed to not care and made us repeat ourselves three times for almost every question he gave. Whenever we actually ordered, we asked for one thing to be taken off due to allergies. Luckily, my boyfriend checked prior to eating since the order was wrong. We kindly asked for it to be re-made and dish was half the size, cold, and lacking in taste. The check was given and without us asking, he walked away and bluntly ignored us the rest of the evening. Not sure if we'll be back due to this experience.

wu2RqhaBOmmXXRCn0bKwxg.text: I have been here 4 times in their first 2 weeks. All of the food is delish! The happy hour is great. Good wine & beer selection. Love the salads. Can't wait to try the pasta. Patio is lovely.

TxspF9NnwqA1DDesFeM4bg.text: Wonderful restaurant we chose for dinner and loved their salads. Great service and cozy atmosphere. Very reasonable on the wallet too.

do1EPShOJ7KnBCMs5R2R2g.text: So impressed by this place. We came on a Saturday night and arrived just before the rush. This place was packed! Food was great and servers were super kind and helpful. Enjoyed two cocktails, the pomegranate monitor and the mandarin mint mule which were both wonderful. The half salad, half pasta was absolutely delicious! It was definitely enough food to be filling. The happy hour specials are great. I took advantage of the cocktail deal, but the craft beer prices were super great. You can tell they're still settling in, as they're a newer place, but we totally loved the experience and will be back soon!

KUIjG4AKLwlCcAMfLh0WrA.text: This place is great! Love the menu selections and prices were cheap for the quality.  Ordered the pear flatbread and southwest philly. Both were very flavorful! Not a fan of shoe string fries but there's were kind of like beer battered shoe string. Very happy they moved in to our neighborhood! Must try!

zNPpi9mMtw8u2wLRjjwlkg.text: A friend took me here for Valentine's Day and we started with drinks. I highly recommend starting off with a pear mule. We tried the Tukee pear quesadilla. I plan on going back just for this appetizer. I would have to say this was by far my favorite thing I ate there. My second favorite thing I tried was the chocolate Berry salad. It was delicious. I tried the butternut squash rigatoni but I will probably not get that next time.

tBdt8iaRS1-Rrwd-ACtbRw.text: The food at PP Bistro is great. Always fresh, and succulent. Who would have thought a salad place could be so versatile. The only weakness here is the service. Tho the staff tries to be nice, and do what they can; during the lunch hour they seem to get a bit overwhelmed. It's as if they are not prepared for a busy lunch rush, and as a result are forced to either dissuade people from having lunch there, or worse, not serve to the level of expectation. I mention this because my colleagues and I went there of course, and undoubtedly so, they told us "yea you might not want to stay here if your on break" in which I could appreciate the concern but it came off as if they didn't want the business. I'd rather make that decision or come to that conclusion myself, not be told as if I'm being told to leave.. Once again, the food and prices make up for the laps in service, but it's unfortunate that they are lacking in that particular area...

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Frozen pair sangria, taste like heavenly pears very very good

VPF7Q2gJPf-k8t7uOAztHA.text: Great place ! Great food (most importantly) , good atmosphere, and very friendly staff ! Their pastas are delicious ! Definitely recommending this place !!! Compliments to the chef !

Bnbo_o-oleGF-KWX1Tv9Xw.text: Very good place!  We had a Cuban sandwich which was delicious!  The service was good and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming.

4fXxCXjJKCpF35KoqiJpWw.text: I love the atmosphere at perfect pear! We had good service and they had my favorite beer. Didn't like the sweet bread on my grilled cheese, but other than that it was a great experience!

q4fS5t3QzHPRZf9yb5-JmA.text: Stellar service the moment we sat down. When you have two kiddos and the server is sharp enough to get them distracted, as a parent you know your already going to tip this person 30%. This is regardless of how good the rest of the experience is. Then, we ordered, food was exceptional. We went simple with Brussels, a sandwich and sweet potato fries because we don't know when the next meltdown is. Again, service was on point, with dropping the check, clearing and being present but not overbearing. Can't wait to go back for date night.

JYS5NAxw3BG24PrwyHhf0g.text: Great food and great ambiance! I love this place and they have amazing Grilled cheese options! Their pastas are good too. Try and stop by for happy hour for great deals!

pdmfuy9rmsAyYp2hNlnolQ.text: Creative menu of good bar food in a pub style restaurant with smart decor, very friendly servers and great bartenders!  Stopped in here for a business lunch being located close to Tempe, AZ.  Great atmosphere here, lots of fun, great bar with very friendly bartenders. It's a lively place, and a nice place to meet someone for a meal.  We sat at the bar, ordered some nice beers, and ordered our lunch. I had the Carnitas Tacos with pulled pork. Not as good as it looked, mostly ordinary and a little dry. But I was in the mood for pulled pork and it went down good.  My business friend got the marble Cuban sandwich with roasted pulled pork, mustard and cheese. He said it was good but nothing over-the-top.  But the atmosphere here and the friendly servers make up for the average food. A recommended stop if you're looking for a lively place with good beer on tap and good pub food.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Had the carnitas Tacos.
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Had the marbled Cuban sandwhich.
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Marbled Cuban sandwich with pulled pork.

9gBnCGVJexjYttzWzGeShg.text: (Lyrics - Trisha Yearwood - Perfect Love  Sunday morning when the menu comes Let's read it front to back and see what's going on Drink our coffee out by the patio and talk about the food That's running through our heads  When you serve me the way you do I can't help but Yelp right back at you  Yeah, this is at the Perfect Pear We're eating everything what the Perfect Pear serves We're all trying the Grilled Goodness It's just you and me at the Perfect Pear  Locally own and serving up some fun delectable food; Perfect Pear Bistro has my palates and food IQ intriqued!  From Roasted Squash Tacos, Green Chili Mac, and Quinoa Bowls, they definitely have fun in the kitchen with this menu.  I however can be a sucker for grilled cheese sandwiches and they seem to have plenty on the menu.  I shot for the Grilled Goodness; roasted butternut squash, bacon, caramelized onions, arugula, and four cheese blend on a crusted 9 grain bread.  Overall, a solid bite of grilled cheese with the extra ingredients like the crispy and saltiness of the bacon and strong earthy scent and taste of the arugula.  The roasted squash was mellow, but definitely provided and rustic sense to the sandwich.  My dilemma with the sandwich was it was light on the cheese, which I thought they could have added an extra layer.  The sandwich also came with side and I choose the fruit salad; which was good, but man the crinkle cut flat sweet potato fries were crispy to the bite!  Love me some crispy fries and thanks to my buddy that shared.    In the end, Perfect Pear Bistro had a fun menu and also afterwards I didn't feel like over ate.  Matter fact the menu made me feel lighter and refreshed.  I love their patio area which provided a brunch like atmosphere and while the interior was rustic and had an Arizona western like feel. - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Goodness

BxaOJX9dgt3x04dEkwjBGA.text: So fresh and fun.  The buffalo cauliflower and brussel sprouts were amazing. If you struggle getting your vegetables, this is the perfect place to go and be amazed at how good those dreaded legumes can taste.

n7T0fdLyLKZmPjctqMt6Rg.text: I had been seated at the bar for 12 minutes when the bartender with purple hair finally came and asked for my drink order. I was reading and didn't mind the wait, and When she asked, I responded that I was ready to order completely and she rolled her eyes and said 'ok, but can I have your drink order?' which left me taken aback. I gave her my drink order and asked if I could tell her my dish since I had been waiting so long, to which she replied she had a couple of tables ahead of me and she needed to allow them to order first. She could tell by my face that I was perplexed, so she rolled her eyes AGAIN, and while filling my water said 'fine. Give me your order and I guess I'll put it in while I'm trying to make your drink.' She was so incredibly rude and I was so taken aback that I just got up and left. This is really unfortunate because I've loved coming here and I use PP often to cater for my company. I'll definitely be taking a break and hope the woman who was tending understands how ridiculous she was being, as well as incredibly rude. All I wanted was a freakin' grilled cheese sandwich.

Z9oIZxvp_zxX8ASAkQ_0GA.text: Fun place to go!  We will go back again!  Great food and service.  We enjoyed the whole experience. Great vibe!

_-PICdKsuwNZZf6q_wPpvg.text: Wow!! I can see why this little gem of a restaurant has 200 reviews!! I found this bistro by accident when picking up some family at the airport (I don't live in the east valley).  There was 7 of us & the wait staff was all over taking care of our AZ visitors - from the constant refills of their delicious iced peach green tea to splitting our orders on 2 different plates to taking our group picture at the end of our visit.  We sampled a variety of menu items... salads, jalapeno & bacon grilled cheese, sandwiches, Cubano sandwich & oh, those sweet potato fries! Yum!! I wish I had room for dessert. Something to look forward to because we'll be back!! If you're here in the cooler months... try out their patio - so lovely. Enjoy

o1PLn5KKcG2YKuNvLZnYdA.text: Love this place - the salads are delicious.  Drinks, Mac n cheese, and brussel sprouts were all very good.

JKJ7eDjaAEiKMBlRDu9hWA.text: Worst service, slow to even talk to you. We sat for 10 min wsited food came fast. No refills. Then sat and waited for a whilr to wsitress to get our bill. Table next to us got so made they hadnt been waited on they started calling for waitress. Then tapping sppons to glasses to get attention of hostess who said she couldnt take orders.  I would never come back here. O ya it took aother 12 min to get our crefit card/ bill to sign..

zWct98oudnnCuxTwAHkeyA.text: Got the salmon bowl, it was so bland and flavorless. My bf got the pesto pasta, it was ok it was just so watery. There was a pool of it on the bottom. The appetizer was good, it was a queso. For four people though it was $80 which is crazy for a lunch that was not good. Overpriced for what you get. Even if it was cheaper I wouldn't come back.

0H6WAsFUeoUXBiOK0Or4Vg.text: Fun options of unhealthy food that is healthy here.  Great food without the guilt.  Need to visit multiple times to test them all out. Service is prompt and competent. Relaxed, quiet setting ...  Would return for lunch dinner or breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fall greens salad extra avocado and bacon make this divine

S0cBUWLf-DC1AoOOG0VR5Q.text: I had the Perfect Pear Classic Salad. It was better than expected. Could have done w more chicken but overall it had a great balance of flavor. The only downside or reason for a 3 vs a 4 star would be the service. The staff seems stressed out and are not always friendly or attentive when you try and and gain their attention. *this is my 5th visit as I didn't want to just catch the staff on a bad day. Sadly this has not changed.

enkVc_gWJlljlHvbuIsBog.text: Was looking for tasty comfort food that in a pleasant environment and found just what I was craving in their mushroom melt and apple cobbler Ala mode.  Pleasant waitress and non-chain feel out on the patio completed the experience.   But then I went in the bathroom and the horrible chemical deodorizer was overpowering.  There was a spray can of the kind of deodorizer that works by deadening taste/smell laying out to complete the assault on my pleasant mood.  I suddenly felt like I was in a gas station bathroom and dashed out to write this review in hopes that they reconsider the deodorizer assault.

PfzfsI0bjay7Ew1Er_LdPQ.text: Excellent. Nice atmosphere and great food. Recommend the hummus nachos and peanut curry chicken bowl...yum!

ULZANcucLd2AvrPBoSQVLg.text: Great food, good environment, excellent service! Definitely recommend and one of our favorite local spots.

dtXp_-9Pt4ONyDVFkUvAMA.text: Very nice ambience as long as there are no loud people. The acoustics tend to echo with people talking loud. The food was very unique and tasty. We had the jalapeno grilled cheese sandwich and the perfectly grilled cheese. Both items were good. For sides we had the tomato basil soup and salad which were ok.  Customer service was good and the food came quickly.     If your looking for a spot to get lunch this is a nice place to go

SRXJOOEeY_Pv1mWsodRIOg.text: Ate lunch here and had an enjoyable afternoon. The food is very good I had the carnitas tacos very nicely done my guest had a sandwich that she noted as exceptional. Nice atmosphere good food reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

QU1q1v0qA6WZirzEUCkYxw.text: Just finished having a delicious lunch. I had the pesto grilled cheese with sweet potato fries and hubby had the Southwest Philly with fries. Everything was yummy. For sure we'll be coming back for there awesome happy hour.

of2F5n0IXoyNZUrV5Fds3w.text: Love this place. Great food, fresh! Very consistent with quality and service. Fair prices. Many beer choices.

uRzrOF0koZQA1RtAU-cPMA.text: This is a cute small restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.  Their menu has a variety of options from salads, sandwiches, to pasta. Based on the reviews I was eager to try this place to see what it was all about. I ordered the Baja like salad. The presentation was nice, all the colors of the rainbow on my plate. As for flavor, it was just okay. The dressing didn't have much flavor and as the name might suggest, I didn't taste much lime. My friend ordered pesto Mac and cheese which I tasted and it was good although I didn't taste any cheese. It seemed more like a pesto pasta dish than a Mac and cheese pasta dish. Overall this place is just okay. I would probably return if someone wanted to meet up there but unlikely that I'll go back on my own

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baja Lime Salad

2s-9cxuziJL9sR_bZpN_HQ.text: I love this place! It is the perfect spot for ladies who lunch. Not that I am a woman of leisure by any means but this location is not too far from my office but still just outside of the ASU bubble so if I am meeting a friend they won't have to deal with the parking or traffic issues. They have really fantastic salads so that is my go-to option. You can choose from 2 different choices of base greens and a protein but then each has it's own distinct flavor due to the additional veggies, add-ons, and housemade dressing. My favorite is the Baja Lime with house blend greens (kale and spinach) and add shrimp. They also have a fantastic unsweetened iced green tea. Everyone that I have eaten with here has loved the food. The service is always pretty good too. They also have a lovely patio that is even doable in the summer due to the fans and misters.

uhrEtrNy3_M0QlNwpwUR7w.text: Really liked this place. Today was a perfect day for Patio weather. I ordered the greekadilla and thought it was perfect to share and was very good to eat. My friend ordered the tomato bisque soup but wasn't a fan of it. The wait staff were really nice and checked on us quite frequently. I saw a few other things on the menu that I'm def coming back for.

SW0kX8rkY079R-vkIddV1w.text: Absolutely delicious food! The salads were HUGE and the Mac n cheese was fantastic!!!

bC5b3AaypLDwmA3Yt5wexw.text: Delicious food and super cute atmosphere. Tons of options made it very difficult deciding what to order. Highly highly recommend.

YAsBY2VwfaF1I5aBNKcJPA.text: Found the Perfect Pear on Yelp.  Had time to kill for an early dinner before flying out of PHX. Server and bartender were super friendly and made great recommendations.   I had the lemon linguine with chicken, cherry tomatoes and parm, and the pear Cobb salad.  2 glasses of Chardonnay.

idTXn20wQA_a2ByBaRVo4g.text: Great date spot or any time you are craving great food in a cute location! Outdoor sitting with twinkle lights is always beautiful ! Their menu has combinations that might seem odd but NEVER disappoint! Their quinoa bowls make me so happy and all their pastas have an amazing sauce to give it so much flavor! Their sandwiches and appetizers are a hit as well!!! Can't go wrong taking anyone to this place since the menu caters to almost every need!

R5EIznxHLaDUuiLPSdxeVg.text: Out of this WORLD BLT SANDWICH! I wish i could scream it off of south mountain to let all of the Phoenix area know that the crispest bacon, lettuce, tomato, AVOCADO and spicy mayo sauce sandwich IS HERE. I'm such an avocado person and of course, who doesn't love GOOD bacon (not that saggy, soggy, floppy shit you get at some places) this bacon is salty, crunchy, tasty and not burnt or fatty at all. My boyfriend and I don't go out to eat that often but we ALWAYS make this sandwich a priority on the weekends when we are able to go together. Also, I'm especially happy to say that he surprised me tonight by picking it up and bringing it home and the sandwich withheld the ride. (You know how that goes, you get something on the go or pick it up and it's half way icky by the time your home) oh, i didn't even talk about the bread yet - all I'm going to say is, it's worth the carbs

G11xcPXp26XaHMPNZFTYgw.text: First of all, how quaint is this patio?! Aside from the sounds of the cars driving 10 feet from your ears, I feel like I'm transported out of Arizona and into some adorable country side restaurant. Huge plus that it's pup-friendly too. This is my second time here and both times my husband and I ordered the Pear Mule - not too sweet, not too strong...it's juust right! Last time I got the Harvest Sandwich which was major noms, but this time I hit the jackpot with the Peanut Coconut Curry Quinoa Bowl. I think this would be great as a wrap as well. This will pair well with the colder temps in the upcoming months. I've got my eye on the Baja Lime and the Berry Avocado bowl for my next visit. Overall, if you want a cute place to eat clean I would highly recommend this place. Both times our bill was around $35 for 2 meals, and 2 drinks. (Happy hour the pear mule is $6.5 compared to $8 for the regular pricing)

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Peanut coconut curry quinoa bowl

LdzHNDnP-0NIqq9Hj2PFKA.text: The food here was amazing! It is great to have clean eating options while traveling for work. This place was awesome!  I loved the added touch of the server bringing me a cup to go of their Pear Jasmine Green Tea when she brought my credit card back.   Definitely go!

Gjjxs-DauiDOHcohR-zxQQ.text: Nice place for a quite, relaxing lunch. Small but effective beer offering. Top shelf noshes.

FN1Lc6O5VBh_PEKU4WJ3Cg.text: Great food and service. They accommodated a large group at the last minute with good and friendly service and food was prompt. Many compliments from all in the group.

9oAYbmoOK9tBYHCNWvM7OA.text: Ambiance: Very subtle, well thought out to bring out comfort and ease to customers. The photo taken from the seat I was at could've been mistaken for a restaurant overseas. Service: Does not exactly have the A-game on. We got here at 45min before closing with only 2 other tables indoors. The water/wine girl ended up getting our order in and disclosed she was not confident if she could get it right. The salad came within a reasonable time, but the mains came right after before we could finish our salad. 15min before close, as I'm finishing my pasta, the server dropped off the bill without asking if we need anything else (more drinks, dessert, etc) Food: For the price of $12.49 and getting a decent sized salad and pasta at a full service restaurant, there's not much to complain. Not a full flavor, but was fresh. Definitely packaged  pasta was used. No fresh ground pepper or parmesan is offered. Table side salt and pepper is hard to come out. Grilled cheese was good with pesto and vegetables, but timing of food lost the gooey aspect.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Representative photos of the ambiance
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

i7LCmnvafhRX0XNFigGfwQ.text: Great menu selection with not run of mill chain choices. Good service. Great atmosphere.

VfoPxqQFwDaDzNwAUJhEiQ.text: What a pleasant surprise. The food was excellent and the friendly staff made it worth the trip. A return visit soon.

0fbenS7qPj8yXyZhAhgccg.text: Cute little place, patio too. I had the butternut squash pasta dish with falafel and it was yummy. Only thing was that the sauce kind of lacked in flavor and could've also used more sauce. My family liked their plates as well. Their menu is salads, pasta, quinoa. Service was alright. Will probably come back again for a lunch date and try their quinoa.

2kAMW2cYNfq70DNBoUDKzQ.text: This is one of my daughter's favorite restaurants. We tossed around ideas for dinner that night, and she really wanted to go to PP, so I gave in.  She can't get enough of the butternut squash tacos. I ordered the Quinoa bowl with roasted veggies and pesto. The food was hot; however, the bowl was SWIMMING in oil. The flavor of this dish is so strong and heavy. It definitely needed a LOT less oil and more quinoa to distribute the flavor. I told the waitress that it had too much oil ( you could see it and spoon it up in the bowl) and she acknowledged that the cook was brand new and didn't quite have the recipes down yet. But she did not offer to give us a discount or refund, or a free dessert which would have made me feel a bit better. I would not choose to go back here (although i probably will for my daughter).

Afl9vdac9BQT3hmiBiWV4Q.text: I happened to see the name of this little Bistro in a post in Facebook.  It did not disappoint.  They have an extensive menu without being overwhelming.  Soups, salads, sandwiches, and even pasta dishes.  They have a list of grilled cheese sandwiches that I wish I could eat because they sound delicious (I have sensitivities to milk products), but I just might one of these days.  We had the Tukee Pear, which is a quesadilla and it was just perfect.  I had the French Pantry, which was delicious and my friend had the Creamy Butternut Rigatoni, which I got to try and it was scrumptious!  For dessert our server recommended the Peach Cobbler, which was sweet and mouthwatering!  We went on a Monday night and were seated right away.  Service was friendly, although it was slow, but I have come to learn that good food takes time, and we had nothing but time when we went. :)

w1W5z92hUOSieaDJkmd3RA.text: Enjoyed the place. Good food, friendly service, nice atmosphere. There were 7 of us and everyone liked what they ordered. We shared a couple of appetizers & deserts and we all liked those as well. I had the grilled cheese on their house-made pear bread. I don't think I've ever ordered grilled cheese for dinner, but that pear bread was so good! Our server was really good. She stayed on top of everything and was very nice. We'll definitely be back.

nvJnB_tjLxbNtQsanhq3cg.text: This is the perfect lunch or dinner spot if you're looking for something calm, light, and easy. The menu is huge with a number of salads, sandwiches, and pastas to choose from; they also have a few southwestern options, and of course their grilled cheese menu! Order the sweet potato fries if you have the choice of a side with your dish. I've tried a number of salads and pastas here, and one or two sandwiches/grilled cheeses, and liked everything I've gotten.   The outdoor patio is beautiful, and there's always plenty of open seating. The indoor restaurant has a really nice atmosphere, too. Service is a little spotty - I've had both good and bad experiences, so just be aware that that component varies quite a bit.

jdeDGBLqg21Xjazs294oVQ.text: For the discerning palette, one word needs to be communicated about this place...  Mediocrity.  The service: Mediocre  The drinks: Mediocre  The food: Mediocre  The music: FABULOUS!!!   The parking: Mediocre  To be honest... mediocre is putting it nicely.  I've been here twice and both times the food was lackluster. The only positive is the beer selection and the music selection.

DyLsey29obQC4NKG0yAYJQ.text: The food is definitely fresh and well made. I can't speak for the dine-in service. On the other hand, the phone service NOT so good. Time and time again they have been rude on the phone. Here are a couple of my experiences...  I called in an order for pickup the next day. The order was for 7-8. I knew not to ask them to put peoples names on each meal as they made it very clear with a previous pickup order that they couldn't do that. So, this time I asked if they could identify the dishes so we would know how to match the meal to the person. You know, put initials on the containers. Her reply with a sigh and tone of frustration speaking so fast I could hardly understand "Well that's our busiest time! We won't have time to do that!" I felt like I was asking way too much and she made it very clear! If they don't label their meals, there is a way to let people know without making them feel like a burden.  Another time (keep in mind this is a 2 min. conversation at the most) I called in a takeout order and she assumed I wanted it immediately. She never asked what time I would like to pick it up so after placing the order, I told her I would be picking it up in an hour. Again, talking so fast I had to ask her to repeat herself. With a sigh and again talking so fast I could hardly understand, she said with frustration in her tone- "well! The order has already been sent back. I'll have to tell them!" I felt like I did something wrong or required too much. I felt like a burden! She was so put out that she had to recall the order and she wanted me to know it!

T6hErXm3kPei_qLZRkNCMw.text: Was so excited to try this place after seeing all the vegetarian options! I could eat over half the things on the menu which is pretty exciting! It was certainly hard to decide. I got pesto goat cheese to start. The goat cheese was really good but the bread wasn't very good, just tasted like kinda stale plain bread. For my meal I got the buffalo falafel sandwich. It was good but there was a little too much sauce on it, I'd ask for it on the side next time. Sweet potato fries were some of the best I've had, perfectly crunchy. I also got to have a couple bites of the butternut squash pasta (without bacon) and it was very good, though I think I liked my sandwich more. Service was good, a little slow but not too bad. We sat outside and it was pretty with all the little lights! Prices aren't bad either, I'd come back here to try more vegetarian dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pesto goat cheese
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Butternut squash pasta
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buffalo falafel sandwich

E8ijZSZOrRjG2f8PRTnkcw.text: The 4th star is really for the ambiance, and the missing 5th star is for the service. iPad a salad and a pasta - food was fine, nothing special. The patio is adorable and creates a fun dining experience.

dzaycyxlhbQrYklKdsKg2w.text: Perfect Pear is really conveniently located for ASU students, right past Oreganos. Its always pretty quiet, and there is never a wait. They have an expansive patio and good-sized indoor area as well, so it is really good for large groups, especially if you don't have a reservation. Chances are that you will be able to sit down right away. The best part is that it is so dang cute! They have beautiful string lights and the patio is so nicely decorated.  Every time I have gone here, I have gotten different kinds of their pasta. Its nothing to special, but definitely satisfying and fine for what you're paying for. I like their gma's mac n' cheese (probably because I'm a mac n' cheese fiend.) They also have a pretty good drink menu, and I haven't been dissapointed from any of the drinks I've had there. I personally like their pear mule, it has a good kick with the right amount of alcohol. Their desserts are also pretty good! This is a good place for birthday dinners and things of that nature.

Ax_AmlFsmIVB1p1k_Bzq7A.text: I detest chain restaurants - it's like getting produce at Walmart - it's kind of ok - but you feel like it's been handled by so many people and boiled down to the lowest common denominator - they're usually uninspired and don't worry too much about making you feel "wanted" and "delighted" with your food and experience.  So ... I'm so glad I found the Perfect Pear Bistro!  We've been doing an event once a week in Tempe, and we're finding each time we just want to go back to the PPB.  Shishito Peppers!  YUM - inspired me so much I bought some and tried them at home.  Your's are better!  Buffalo Cauliflower - a little over the top on the Buffalo - but oh my!  Yum!  I've tried this at home as well - I kind of like mine - with a Feta/Cream/Goat cheese dip.. but I'll order again!  I've had your Tomato Basil soup - very well done - tasty without going over the top - I could still taste the tomato - but it was in no way bland!  The specialty drinks we have had are fantastic! But I have to say my favorite was the Bacon Jalapeno sandwich.  Y U M !!!    Can't wait for my next visit!

FRfqM_Cvd68DjGZ26f3gHg.text: WOW!  First time here.  Amazing service (thank you Sabrina) and great food!   Lots to choose from - there's something for everyone.  Perfectly Grilled Cheese is a "thumbs up".  1/2 salad 1/2 pasta combo was a hit and Cuban sandwich w/sweet potato fries --- very yummy!    Fun atmosphere.  Easy to carry on conversations without having to raise your voice.  If you find yourself in Tempe, check it out.

cJkKljC6ZyvYt3AN4k0xJQ.text: Ambience definitely contributed to my rating. The food was a 4.7/5 for me though. There are a lot of healthy options available and a wide variety of options. (Mexican inspired, Italian inspired, and Asian inspired cuisine) all with a modern twist. They have outdoor seating options and *don't worry* there are heaters and a fire place to keep you cozy. The food was tasty and cooked well for the most part. Some things lacked a little salt and others were slightly under or over cooked. By this I mean VERY slightly. If you're not overly picky, and appreciate good health food, this will be the perfect place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

_3z5C8WEf8ONQvBDTBSGyQ.text: Wow! You have to try this place!  I chose based on location (we were at a film festival in Tempe   and because it met my needs (dairy free options) plus my wife's vegetarian needs.  Plus Yelp reviewer's gave it 4.5 stars.   You can order ala cart or pick a pair.  One bowl of soup plus a salad, one salad plus a pasta, one bowl of soup plus a pasta, BUT you cannot get half a sandwich with either pasta, salad or soup.  I think that should be an option. But no matter. My wife got the tomato basil soup and the pair salad. She loved both, and was impressed how many ingredients were in the salad ( nuts berries, pair, cheese).  I ordered the curry chicken soup (coconut milk) and a sandwich of chicken, bacon, and avocado.  The sandwich was terrific, but the star of the show was the soup. It was flat out one of the best soups I've had. It was a bit spicy, but I cooled the fire with the house speciality drink- a pair martini.  They have 3 locations, we went to the one on University,  but all 3 get 4.5 stars. We had  5 star meal and service

L1IYFOm86kHrScekf-Nnwg.text: Went here last night and not that I had heard anything bad but I was pleasantly surprised! The restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining with heaters and a fireplace but it was too cold to be outside. The inside has a rustic feel with lower lighting which i personally like. There isn't a set hostess stand which was kind of awkward when you walk in and don't know where to go. However we were quickly addressed by a waitress and told to sit anywhere with silverware.   There's a good amount of menu items which i like and we had a tough time deciding what to get. We decided on the bahn mi sandwich with fries (the waitress did ask if we wanted to do half sweet potato and half regular which was super appreciated because both were great). The regular fries were thin, fresh and salty kinda like McDonald's fries but more home style. And the sweet potato fries were a mix between steak and waffle fries. Both delicious- just like the sandwich which came with a special mayo. We also got the lemon pasta which hit the spot and had a huge portion. My only critique would be it was a bit oily. I told the waitress i had a severe dairy allergy which she didn't seem to completely be knowledgeable about but she did seem to care and made sure she'd ask the kitchen which is all i can ask. One waitress did even let me read a label which made me feel safe. I will say that one criticism was moving tables and talking about gossip loudly was kind of annoying as we were finishing our meal but then again i remember what it's like to be anxious to leave a shift. Overall great food and atmosphere just a little polishing on other points.

soH2LHGua_qWMQImKm_5jQ.text: The food was fresh, tasty, and large portions. I had 1/2 of pasta and salad and I felt like it was 2 complete meals. The cauliflower buffalo was super tasty. The outside patio is great in March and April. We really enjoyed our lunch and are excited to return again. We have nothing but great things to say about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outside patio

kYwBk8LlhO9fTDkqTH0daw.text: Fantastic!  I'd heard great things about Perfect Pear and finally got the chance to give them a try. I'm very glad I took the time out to give them a chance.   The ingredients and flavors are impeccable. I didn't even have time to get a picture of the amazing food since I jumped right in.  I had the chicken club and usually I'm all for the a fried chicken club but figured I'd try out their grilled chicken. Everything was amazing including the fries. Many of their recipes have ingredients you typically wouldn't see on a certain dish but they all mesh so well. Adding on my list of places to come to again in the future!

1ejsUIe8NYg1FcfDNyZbJw.text: I was in town on business and so glad I chose to check this place out!!  The menu was amazing and since I had a hard time choosing, I went with a tapas size appetizer to start (buffalo falafel...so delicious!) then the 1/2 salad and 1/2 pasta selection.  Both so good and WAY bigger than I would ever expect half size portions to be.  I will 100% come back next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buffalo falafel
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Half green chili Mac &amp; Cheese and half Baja salad

BO6W6cn1ANJ7lCzZiuwmEg.text: We came here last minute. And it was a good last minute too.  Food was delicious. They were super accommodating with our 15-month-old. The server was helpful with suggestions of food.  I ordered the Baja Lime Salad (Sooo good!), husband ordered the gluten-free sandwich and we ordered the mac and cheese off the kid's menu, and thank goodness it didn't taste like Kraft mac and cheese.  We will  definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baja lime salad with shrimp
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gluten-free pork sandwich with fruit
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mac n Cheese from the kid&#39;s menu

S0NzxGV6RM0xxslxr2lPMQ.text: What a gem!  Sweet server, casual atmosphere and delicious food.  The berry avocado quinoa bowl with shrimp was truly tasty.

S5Kecs6kA2_I5VnGSWzuwg.text: Recently met with friends here for dinner. We all enjoyed our meals very much. My friend mentioned her allergy to shrimp and the waitress said she would make sure no seafood touched the grill or prep area where her meal was prepared. Unfortunately they did forget to add chicken as requested. The pasta was so delicious that she didn't mind and it was deducted from the paycheck. Rachel was very pleasant and accommodating of our wants and needs during our meal. I would absolutely recommend and return to this wonderful place.

wvfO_KbXtJF2R2KVCJlofA.text: Excellent food and the ambiance is great!   Chose this place based on the reviews and so glad we tried it the lemon pasta was amazing with shrimp and the Cuban sandwich was delicious.

LpIJRmz4Gf5g-bG89UI_EA.text: I love this place for date night. Their patio is romantic. I love trying different things everytime I come here. Everytime I have been I have liked every order I have placed. Their flavors with their food are excellent. The service was great! The waitress was constantly filling our water and checking in on us. Despite the fact that it's off university you can't really hear the street noise. Their food taste so good and is healthy. Overall, would recommend this place for the food, atmosphere and great service.

jiva8PI5ldvkTM43Xm7WyQ.text: Ok... my first visit here didn't go well but that seemed to be an anomaly.  Being a glutton for punishment (plus bored and hungry) I gave it another shot (and then a few more). Well... I'm glad that I did. The service was much better and the food was excellent. By excellent I mean that every meal I've had here was delicious and I would gladly order any of them them again.  It's genuinely good food and reasonably priced. The flavors are nicely balanced and if you like lighter, healthy fare then this is the place for you. The patio also has a nice ambiance to it.  Definitely worth a shot if you're in the area.

p1x75zpHtn9EA8bBFSMMUg.text: Cute cafe. We sat outside and patio had misters kept us cool. Had 1/2 pasta and 1/2 salad. Very tasty. My friend had full pasta and he enjoyed it. We had a great waitress and she was attentive and encouraged the peach pear cobbler which we shared. Would definitely go back

NfD2jmIDSFVk4TayN8YKug.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant and I will be back to try more items on the menu.  It was hard to decide because the menu was pretty diverse and many items sounded good to me.  I went with a Quinoa bowl with strawberries and I enjoyed all the items and flavors of its ingredients.   I also felt that the portion size and price were right on.  Not only that, I felt the items were original and weren't the same as other quinoa bowls I've had elsewhere.  My only criticism is that I think different fruit should be used instead of the strawberries (like dried cherries or something) because they didn't add much flavor.  My dinner date really enjoyed his pasta.  There's something for everyone on the menu.  Service was good.  A small mistake was made on our order and was promptly resolved; no complaints!

-dDQ5ISjvDt85kuVMoXfQg.text: The food was delicious!!! We had a great time, the server took about 20 min to come say anything to us and it was only after we asked the hostess a second time, but besides that the food was great and I'll def be back

H_llltwrGK2pgl4jhqx6bw.text: We had a fabulous meal here and, yes, pears were found in many items from my Moscow Mule, salad and grilled cheese. It was a delight to sit out on the patio as the sun was setting and the spray was on. Just wish we had found this place earlier in our trip instead of our last night in Phoenix.

5aRk_uJrrAz0OMc-10gqYw.text: Leaving four stars only because of an incident at the end of the night. My fiance and I got to the bistro around 8:00pm! Super cute place and a large menu of appetizing foods! Good drink menu too, the Pinot Grigio was delicious! I got the Cuban with a side salad which was impressive! Not just lettuce and dressing! Food was so good! A family with an infant got in at 9:00 and the waitress told them they close in 15 minutes and that there was restaurants open on Mill. Everything was great up until this point. The restaurant closes at 9:30 per their website. I found this extremely rude and unprofessional coming from a restaurant background we always served up until we closed. I was surprised and disappointed. This place was pretty awesome for our first visit!

UdrpjQ2l2yvLS5rHYIF2zQ.text: The owners of Perfect Pear need to be more hands on with this location as the little details that majority of people might not notice are falling through the cracks. This location is in our neighborhood and we go weekly. The staff is friendly enough but lacking attention to detail. Fingers cupping the plate/bowls when bringing out the food, not checking back in after bringing out the meal, lack of eye contact (they seem overwhelmed), very short and without warmth with patron engagement. The food is decent as there are many choices and the servings are typically generous. Their patio is nice - great place to bring a group of friends.

hqT64mzfBmDNGPSd5JXJrA.text: Good food, especially for vegan/vegetarian peeps, and there was a pretty sweet drink list. My bf was a little let down by his choice but he's a picky eater so I'll take his opinion with a grain of salt. I'd like to visit again to try some more menu items and see if I can find a favorite!

wKOXB5segE21L2nFvKYdeg.text: This place has some of the best salads I've ever had. Large portions, very fresh, high quality food products in their salads. First visit and very impressed with the staff by being professional, Courteous and knowledgeable. The atmosphere is dimly lit with an outside patio under cooling misters, old time light bulbs, cabana type. The inside is relatively small but an old wood Caribbean feel with the same type lighting. I would definitely recommend this place. All I say is to be patient on the timing of food. Quality takes time, have a few drinks and time will slip on by, Enjoy!

WucQKYgYZMRFs8NxR7sUlA.text: Menu is very unique and diverse with seasonal touches. I came here with a friend for dinner and ordered the Roasted sprout salad over the house blend lettuce with salmon. It fell a little short of expectation.. but definitely willing to come again, maybe for lunch, and try something different. I would definitely recommend this restaurant as a lunch spot but not for dinner.

NdVLtHL1t148A6SsFshJ0w.text: Delicious! Amazing salad and completely satisfying gooey, deliciousness in the grilled cheese! Can't wait to come back to AZ just to come here!

PoLwBrdaQB0czOmctArPWA.text: Very cool, rustic and intimate atmosphere. Great service, easy parking, good prices ($9-$13), food is delicious, unique and many healthy options as well. The 6 of us (ages 23-57) all loved what we got and had soups, salads, sandwiches, and a specialty grilled cheese. Oh their fries! Looked like they also had good tacos, quinoa bowls wraps and a good variety of beer and wine. We ate inside but they had a nice patio.

p6ONhRNVYAu9U9SiXV_l8w.text: I've been to several locations and food is always great.  However, the service is usually just average.  Have yet to be waited on by a friendly server.  They just seem annoyed that you're there.  But, today at the University Ave in Tempe was particularly unpleasant.  Hostess greeted us... if you wanted to call it a greeting.. with a sour puss on her face, mumbled something, and got annoyed when we didn't answer.  She got exasperated and said "huh??!".   Server was pleasant enough, not all that friendly though.  At one point came over to table and took my plate that still had food in it.  Didn't even ask if I was finished or wanted a to go box.  I've given this place plenty of chances as I love the menu and food is always very good.  But after today's service I likely will not be back.  The hostess was particularly rude.  Can't believe that's her job.  My friend and I did not feel welcome AT ALL when we arrived.

-guC7c820jV5saNmAFRCeQ.text: I have heard about the Perfect Pear Bistro in the other locations for quite some time, so we were excited to try out the newest location that is closer to where we live.
