Great atmosphere inside and out (can't wait to go back with my dog and sit on the patio), friendly service and delicious and reasonably priced food.  We enjoyed the philly cheesesteak sandwich with fries and the mushroom melt with sweet potato fries - seriously yummy!  The menu is quite extensive and I think I would have been happy with any of the sandwiches, salads or pastas.

LYsNHGeNjujIFFdL6KX5xA.text: Was in town for the Rock N Roll half marathon, and wanted a healthy choice. This was the perfect place! Amazing options, huge portions, fast service, and everyone at our table loved their meal. Can't go wrong here and anytime I am back in AZ I will def go back.

TfAP1mR0j-2oAkeOtkFh2Q.text: Excellent food, lots of healthy options, lots of gluten free options.  Generous portions, I couldn't finish.  Lots of beers and ciders.

cjj8CreLzKhirXRmKtH7Hg.text: Bomb food and great service! We ordered plenty of different food off the menu, from their green chili Mac n cheese to pesto grilled cheese and a couple different salads. Everything was fresh & tasty! This place has an awesome atmosphere and outdoor/patio area. I can't wait to come back when it's a bit warmer outside to sit outside!

-UbCkTLB-RUz8gYcyFS9rA.text: Such a great restaurants for a vegetarian their are tons of options I had the vegetarian focatia sandwich with corn soup and it was amazing. The French fries also look great. I can't wait to go back again

hV8SkVFzADWFYbTmyB1Mrw.text: Green chili queso dip came out lukewarm, on the verge of being cold, and so did the tomato basil soup. I have the original grilled cheese and the bread was soggy from grease.

6foIEMgqz9nSoMW6P8LUAw.text: Very accommodating for my gluten allergy and great happy hour! The servers were very knowledgeable about what items contained gluten. They even have GF bread! I'll definitely come back when in Tempe again!

ao2B64ihiOxDqa3rnSmCQg.text: This is a hidden gem. The food the ambience the service all a five-star. Next time we're in Arizona we will be coming back here. If you're looking for a trendy place with great food and a great vibe this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

fzCtZXZDuNZO5yEVonaQVw.text: Service was definitely slow and subpar, I went on a Friday night and waited 7or so minutes to get greeted (sat at the bar) the staff was busy cleaning up, it looked like they were trying to close up even though they were not closing for a few more hours. Besides that the menu was interesting and our food was pretty good. I can't say I'll be going back but it's definitely a place to check out even if it is just once.

7qaN8d1A4JlrK__gamduNQ.text: Nice place for lunch. The green chile bisque was delicious and their salads are consistently good.

JmKK4eJVXmg0zKj_uv5GQg.text: Very very good food. Great patio with mister system it made our afternoon lunch enjoyable in the wonderful Arizona summer.

7aJ65uJObMdAIWwk3gFnhQ.text: Oh my lord! Found this place on Yelp because I was in the Tempe area for a meeting. I ordered the quad city melt, with perfectly cooked roast beef, sauteed mushrooms, cheese, and a spicy chipotle mayo. The combinations of flavors were so damn good, I had to stop myself from overeating! I got the sweet potato fries as a side and they were cooked perfectly! Crispy, not too salty, and honestly the best I've had ever. Can't wait to come back and try their other sandwiches and salads! Great beers on tap and wine too. A++. Service was good, the only minuscule thing I could suggest would be to play some music other than what they were playing. But, it is just down the street from a college campus, so maybe I'm alone in this. The patio is gorgeous and interior decor is very inviting. Change up the music!

qt42Ki5QGlVlg__d8_xuyA.text: My coworkers and I stopped in here because of the positive yelp reviews and the Perfect Pear did not disappoint.  We all had grilled cheese sandwiches and soup which was the perfect comfort food.  Cozy little place with a nice patio.  Would definitely go back the next time I am in Tempe.

-cF6S3YnCDXYW6EPyExl1A.text: This menu is ridiculous!  Rarely find a menu where you want to try everything.  We totally stumbled on this place for lunch and were impressed with service and food. My life partner, Melba, had a delicious salad and I had quinoa curry bowl which were all really good as well as the fresh guacamole. Great iced tea!  We can't find one negative thing about this place. Very very good job. Melba really loved the patio.

J1npt0eLg_nRcf9u78MB3A.text: Wow, a great place!  We had lunch on a Friday, sat at the bar.  A unique menu with a happy hour starting at 11:00 a.m.  My wife & I, both of which have a background in food service, management, & ownership, were impressed by the synergy of the restaurant crew.  The prices aren't bad and the food quality is superb.  My wife had a grilled cheese with sweet potato fries.  The fries maybe were a little over-cooked, but nothing to complain about.  I had their cobb salad and shrimp corn chowder soup.  Our only regret is there is not a Perfect Pear Bistro in Scottsdale.

t_94qu4csKQVTQe_qKYHNw.text: I love this place!! You just can't beat a good gluten-free-friendly place with SO many options. Great patio. Great happy hour. The Cuban was so so good!! Definitely eat here!! :)

758QHddjkmoUEz6x5xAwQQ.text: I really enjoy the food at this neighborhood spot and (used to) come for happy hour often with my ladies. The patio always has a nice vibe, with guests and their doggos hanging out with a glass of wine despite it being a million degrees outside.   On my last visit, my card was charged an additional 9$ (assuming the server tipped herself). I didn't tip on the card because I left cash. I did email them and the manager did respond promptly asking me to give him a call. But eh, it's 9 bucks and by the time I saw his email, I had been out of town for a week. Didn't seem worth it to call. I just doubt that I'll ever go back. It left a bad taste in my mouth and I hope the server realizes losing her job isn't worth such a small amount of money. Any respectable establishment has their servers go through their receipts at the end of the night in order to avoid any potential mistakes like this.   There's too many cool places around the valley that also have delicious food to bother coming here again and receive lackluster (and either dishonest or careless) service. Looking back on all my experiences here, the service is the one thing that stands out in a negative way. This was my first time sitting at a table, but none of the bartenders are ever friendly or even behind the bar to be helpful. Where do all the servers disappear off to?? The atmosphere is nice and the managers on duty always seem to be engaged with what's going on in the dining room and I really appreciate that as I come from a restaurant background myself.   The food IS tasty though, and I was looking forward to trying everything on the menu at some point... All of the appetizers are wonderful. On our last visit, my friends and I all got different pasta dishes. If you do go, I'd recommend the Mediterranean Mac & Cheese - I ate every stinkin' bite. I remember the Creamy Mushroom Marsala being extremely flavorful and delicious as well, and I don't particularly even enjoy mushrooms!

xHD7TJkpHxKeotsFdoDJxQ.text: Have eaten here a couple of times - once for lunch and once for dinner. Food is excellent and reasonably priced and service was good. Can be a little loud for conversations because of acoustics, but overall a good place to eat.

sR-QOtsOEZtk8cFd9kumfw.text: Dined alone after a business meeting in Tempe. Fantastic fresh and grilled veggies with cold quinoa salad, nice mid-price wine selection, and charming service. Very comfortable place to read and relax over coffee, too.

tlpyHc63YFVc_pc0xWwaFA.text: This place has great food and a great happy hour! Plus a dog friendly patio :)

NujI73sEaGoSS9iwqnyGRg.text: I love this place. Good food, good service, good atmosphere. I almost always get their Brussels Sprout salad.

lhqTR69VHvekQ92t8-USAQ.text: Great salads, and excellent service. I've eaten here twice now and both times were a pleasant experience.

MhiLMOKMXijJ5UvwaSSmEQ.text: This was a random find for me when I was looking to expand my horizons past my typical restaurants.  It was a bit of a drive for me and it was located in a bit of an odd area, but it was very cute when I walked in!    They had a huge selection of items on the menu and is definitely a good place to go if your group has a wide selection of food opinions.  I got the flatbread and it was very tasty.  It was a bit small so if you have a large appetite, I would recommend order something else as well!  Overall, Perfect Pear Bistro was pretty tasty and cute, as well as reasonably priced!

OxfyQItKnQpb01F3jcjr7Q.text: Great happy hour (11a to 6p), great food (huge salads, fresh ingredients, house-made dressings, lots of options), decent if small beer selection; inconsistent service. On a slow Tuesday we received very attentive service indoors; on a busy Wednesday (1 day later) we sat on the Patio for 20 minutes before anyone took our order; we ended up ordering takeout.  Worth a trip but be prepared to wait if it's busy.

qKUgQ73dm6ogJAI4Ge-ZHA.text: What an amazing place.  Very diverse menu and the food is awesome and healthy at the same time.  Prices are great too and the service is excellent.

jbQpWOo5Yz9M8AbZHZdX0w.text: Great! This place really has it all! Located near ASU, but with PARKING and a great patio! The food is great! Salad greens are always fresh, the grilled cheese is amazing and the Peanut Curry Quinoa bowl is a must try. The service was top notch especially for a large group during lunch. They have a bar and best thing this is a locally owned restaurant. Check them out!

P4-e7DgZU_MuafqVuytXOw.text: loved the selection of salads, bowls , pasta and sandwiches.. excellent hostesses and wait staff as well! We went for dinner and the patio was super cute with the lights.

skhrXCKxYJg75U73NlXqcg.text: Loved the food and the ambiance. I can't wait to go again this fall when the weather cools off. The patio seating is delightful.

uAzHuOUq_34RcgNxtviHIw.text: So me and 2 co workers went here for lunch. It's a nice little quaint place with inside and patio seating.  Service was good real attentive with smiles which is a A+ in my book.  The menu was simple and healthy and real tasty. Started with buffalo cauliflower amazing, who knew cauliflower could taste so good with buffalo sauce and blu cheese crumbles on it. Also had the chicken sandwich on a nice soft roll with a balsamic dressing. The chicken was nice and juicy really well cooked. Not dry at all. This place is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buffalo cauliflower, really tasty.

j7Pr1nG12PL_Z0miQeNXDA.text: Our family of five stopped here after our 5k Autism walk in downtown Tempe. View from the street is sadly unimpressive. The parking lot had us wondering if they were open for business. Upon entering the back door however, we were drawn into the quaint, shaded patio. Plenty of seating there and comfortable enough to sit all afternoon.   The dining room was small and comfortable. The bar, lighting and music all set for the perfect ambiance. We were greeted and seated promptly and the service throughout the meal was superb.   The menu upon first glance was impressively healthy & a far cry from the usual burgers and bar fair. Yes, they have sandwiches, salads and wraps but the ingredients and layers are above and beyond ordinary.   If you're in the Tempe area, you must stop here for lunch or HH!   Tip! Try the Pizza Bread, it's amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

UuYJ-gMO_lRuC_lC7uhfpA.text: After taking a tour of AZ Distilling Co., decided to try this place next door.  My friends and I enjoyed our lunch experience here very much!  Tip #1 - Sit outside if the weather isn't too warm.  They've got a beautiful patio area with plenty of shade.  The menu has a lot of options.  I went with the chicken pesto sandwich.  Overall it was decent, but could have used a little more of the pesto sauce.  The ciabatta bread was a little dry.  I should have tried what my friends had which was the lemon garlic pasta. Portions are average in size.  There is convenient street parking nearby and like I mentioned earlier, the distillery next door if you want to pop by and get a drink.  Tip #2 - Check your food before you eat it.  My friend had a hair on her plate.  Luckily she saw it and it was sitting on the side of her food so it was probably from the waitress.  Still, not something you like to see.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken pesto sandwich

1JmUcMKyQoS4ZtMnWmYVLg.text: Went here for lunch.   I had been at the location on Priest a couple of months ago, but this is closer.   I had the perfect pear classic with the house blend of greens along with chicken in a wrap with sweet potato fries.   My son had the strawberry fields salad with salmon.  The pear/chicken wrap is actually the salad but in a wrap.   Interesting concept.   I asked them to leave out the onions and mint.   Perfect!   There is a lot of chicken in the wrap, a light amount of dressing that matches the salad wrap to perfection, and, therefore, does not make it drippy and soggy.   The pear is sweet and crunchy.  The sweet potato fries were hot and tasty.  We sat out on the patio.   This is the time of the year we can do that.   The service is a bit on the slow side, especially since most people are on a tight timeline for lunch.   Overall, I'd say the food outweighed the service.   We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Field of greens pear/chicken salad in a wrap with sweet potato fries
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Field of greens strawberry salad with the added salmon

JVgjuWPhTaIGaeJ-tJpeuA.text: The Perfect Pear was amazing! I went there with my sister just for a brunch date and we will definitely be going back again soon, everything was delightful. Food tasted great,it looked amazing. I order the chicken pear sandwich with a side salad and the sandwich was really good, it had sprouts, cheese, and sliced pears. This was our first time here and we would definitely go again. I wish i could go there every day!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

JgvpInO66sKx7-Fig4xO3Q.text: I love this place! There is a nice patio where you can sit outside.  Everything I have had here is delicious and fresh.  I would suggest the Butternut Squash tacos or the Pear tacos.

3iz45gqQbD7x38vi70JgDg.text: I went to this restaurant twice before I decided to post a review.  I'm disappointed to report that the food was terrible both times.  We order the spinach dip which is more like a cheesy salsa with big chunks of spinach. Not what I was expecting plus it was served barely warm with ridiculously hard bread and tortilla chips.  It might have tasted better warm.  We also ordered the bacon brie app again served with that ridiculously hard bread.  The bacon was burnt and the cheese was sitting in oil/grease.  A few positives: the service was fantastic, sweet potato fries were yummy and the restaurant has a nice vibe.

9JLV-_zx20ti5D4u5pgKlA.text: A nice place to have lunch. Enjoy the falafel tacos, very tasty. Really good flavor. Awesome craft beer and family friendly place. Also the service was excellent. Hunter treated us really great. Nice and outstanding service! Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

Dz4712uKbP7iNn3Ixt6-vw.text: Perfect Pear Bistro is a lovely place for brunch, lunch, or even linner( lunch+dinner ). During my last visit to AZ, I was fortunate enough to give this place a try after reading my fellow Yelpers reviews. Boy, was I glad I went for it! My dad and I enjoyed this place so much we came back two days in a row!   The place: They have ample seating, we sat outdoors which I recommend as the misters and fans make it enjoyable.  Food: Tacos, salad, bowls, and sandwiches! My first thought when looking at the menu was, what do I even order!? It was so hard to choose just one thing, there were so many great options. Both times I went I ordered tacos: falafel & carnitas . I honestly think you can't really go wrong with any thing on the menu. Service: Throughout our experience, the service was exceptional! We ordered iced tea, and my father and I joked about how every few sips we got another refill! They were so kind and attentive.  Thanks Perfect Pair Bistro!

FFcFSwSBr86JeFbKmksnmQ.text: Great variety of food and a decent lunch spot.   My go to is usually one of the pasta dishes. Gma's mac is good but it's not mind-blowing mac and cheese but it does the job. Tony's Pasta is creamy and delicious!   Their Tukee Pear quesadilla has bacon and pears in it. I thought it was an odd combination but it comes with a sauce that ties in the meal altogether.   I tried their Pesto Grilled Cheese and it was subpar. Would skip out on this next time. The shoestring fries are delicious though! Their strawberry mojito was a bit of a disappointment. Not very tasty and wouldn't order it again.   Overall, it's a great lunch spot since it's close to work!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pesto Grilled Cheese Sandwich with shoestring fries
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear Bacon Quesadilla
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tomato Basil + Grandma&#39;s Mac

LRQHgK_z8dQBaOnA1wE4qA.text: What a cool lunch spot! Great salads and good beer selection. We beat the lunch crowd by getting there right at 11.   Only dropped a star for the wobbly table and limited parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Signature cocktails... wife LOVES the Strawberry Gin Fizz

09ZlviNgkcrLk-3Y16_30g.text: I really liked this place. My boyfriend and I went here on a Friday night in July when it was 120 degrees outside.... so we obviously did not sit outside. Nor did any other guests.... but their patio was open. Misters on and very spacious! I can't wait to go back there when it's not so hot and sit outside. They patio area is adorable. But the inside was smaller than expected, and it was pretty crowded. We sat at the bar and had a couple appetizers. I ordered an old fashioned and honestly it was wayyyy to strong, I had to ask the bartender to top it off with more sprite. Also, I just want to say they have amazing French fries. We will be returning for the patio and French fries

l1ygFnVNXuw34cUCAKlRBw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. When the Lyft dropped me off in the parking lot I wasn't sure what to expect. All the food and drinks were super yummy and I was glad since I dragged 4 other co workers there. All of our meals were fresh, flavorful and good portions. I got the Buffalo chicken Tacos and they were stacked with lots of chicken. We also got the Jalapeno cheese dip and I got the Strawberry Orange Moscow Mule. Ok I might have had 2 of them at lunch. This might be my spot whenever I'm in town for work.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

wTtmbmvDYAnH_975Gl7NxA.text: Saw this place on PBS "Check Please" and also had it bookmarked so had the opportunity for a recent lunch meeting. Upscale, open and unique may best describe it. Plenty of salad, sandwich, and pasta options.  They have a bar and indoor seating. Outside is a covered patio with shade screens and a mister.  Ambient temperature was reasonable for Arizona in the summer time. Place filled up quickly  for a busy lunch crowd.  I had Paco's Pear Tacos with roasted chicken, bacon, chedder cheese, avocado, sprouts, a sauce and spicy pear pico. The two soft tacos were filling and a very good meld of flavors with a little heat. Order came with side of black beans with some pico. The green iced tea was also very good.  Did not notice any desserts, nor were we asked. Saw a pear cobbler on a Yelp photo  so not quite sure what's up. Noise level inside was a bit high but not a big distraction. Service was excellent...still wondering what happened to that pear cobbler for dessert?

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Paco&#39;s Pear Chicken Tacos with Black Bean Side

BHUPZZ9nDPlJFipG9eBkCg.text: Came with a group of ladies for lunch.  It was the lunch hour and quite busy.  We waited 3-5 min while they cleared a table large enough for us.  It took us a few minutes to decide.  Most of us ordered various types of tacos.  Service was fairly quick given the crowds of people in the bistro.  I ordered the Pear taco with small bits of pear, chicken, tomatoes, guacamole, sprouts, lettuce and bacon.  A spicy chipotle sauce comes with it along with their homemade black beans.  The tacos stand at attention in their metal holders.  We had to flag down the wait staff for the bill as it was very busy.  They could have used more staff during the lunch hour.  They will do separate bills provided you let them know up front or will combine bills if requested.  Parking available across the street which is good because it is a busy area.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear Taco
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu front

ALgMA5xD-kUrbmNU1qofqg.text: We've been here 3 or 4 times now and enjoy it each time. What they lack in super friendly/attentive service, they make up for in tasty food.   Some of my favorite things to get:  cream of mushroom soup - so savory and rich!  rosemary linguini - the sauce is heavenly, and the chicken and asparagus are great  peach cobbler - perfection   Their grilled cheese sandwiches are solid. The salads are huge and filling. The sweet potato fries are great without being too heavy.   Like I said, service isn't the warmest or friendliest, but it's acceptable considering the meal is a good time.

DoWL84Lm2oXLzKPClwYE2Q.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! My boyfriend and I have gone twice now to eat. We've tried a few appetizers and entrees now. I've loved everything except the French Pantry sandwich. Too many sauces for me, my mistake for not reading the description enough. But by far the best thing on the menu is the Grilled Cheese. It's served on the yummiest spiced pear bread they make. We always joke about wanting to take home a whole loaf. Great little lunch spot!

J7xU9U2M73mpyosWgAY7aQ.text: Wasn't very impressed by this place, but I definitely wouldn't say it was bad! For a little bistro, they definitely have a decent sized menu with plenty of options. They also have some gourmet grilled cheeses which is a very unique & fun option! I ordered the Chicken Pesto sandwich, & it was alright! Only giving it 3 stars because it wasn't somewhere I would likely go again, but it's definitely good enough to give a try!

AVAZ0_6xUjWefU7NQhTlqA.text: Amazing sandwiches!! Their options here are endless, and their unique flavor combinations satisfy any craving! Their sandwiches are also huge and come with a generous helping of fries (sweet potato or regular!). I came here and ordered take-out, and for a busy Friday lunch, my order was ready to pick up in 20 minutes! I was completely satisfied with our whole order, and I will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

CBkU6VbbbzihFqQ2x3EDvw.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere of this place. The food is great too, I would recommend coming here if you're looking for a healthier lunch or dinner.

fOWQnF4fGRGnpHf0Dx6upQ.text: Maybe the best lunch I have had in quite some time! Soups, sandwiches, everything was outstanding!!! 5 star for sure as well as great service in a great setting!

wdpuLZREIJWEAD10mvPO7Q.text: This is the second time that I have eaten at The Perfect Pear and both times it has been a positive experience. I am attracted to their healthier more whole food approach. I ordered the carnitas tacos and the Greekadilla for the table and they were both a hit. The Greekadilla is a Greek riff on a quesadilla and I couldn't get enough. It came with some sort of cilantro lime sauce and we were almost fighting over the Greekadilla. Do not miss this.  The carnitas tacos were good but nothing special. I would order them again as an appetizer but as my main coarse.  I had the Cuban sandwich as my main coarse and it was very flavorful. It came on marbled rye bread which was a bit out of place but somehow it worked. I could give or take pickles but on this sandwich it makes it all work, leave them on.

KDvNfRZ1FNZxsvCfHBRCVw.text: Good food, GREAT wine selection, and awesome atmosphere. The perfect pear bistro serves up lots of yummy Mediterranean inspired dishes and pastas with a Perfect Pear twist. The butternut squash ravioli is highly recommended!  A good spot for a girls night out, date night, etc.

FJTtxx_qtASXXPqB78Ztng.text: Been there twice and so far the food I've had there is awesome. Not only is the food good but they have good beer choice. Tacos and the quesadilla with chicken are defiantly worth getting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Buffalo chicken tacos

hwQVw38rcpao1ti1nJHniw.text: I've been in the Valley for over 9 years and couldn't believe this was my first time coming here. Super cute spot, great for happy hours. Great cocktails and Mac n cheese! I definitely would come back to try other items on the menu.

1Cbg-Cwhj5uDl1XtJu_mAA.text: Great place to meet near ASU's Tempe campus. Lunch here with two of my favorite former colleagues from the college. Portion sizes were very generous and lots of healthy salad options to help me keep my New Year's diet resolution. I had the wild chop salad- filled with fresh veggies and a really tasty pesto dressing on the side. N and G both ordered soup/salad- large bowls of each. The waitress was really sweet, even went back to the kitchen to double check the ingredients for may dairy-free friend. We were there for two hours catching up and the staff never made us feel like we needed to rush out. Easy, free parking is another reason why I'll be suggesting this place next time I have a meeting with folks from the university.

bSP8LTf_J5GKDVmdMUj59w.text: Great atmosphere, good drinks, fantastic service and impressive gluten-free options. They can pretty much make anything on the regular menu gluten free which is uncommon however very appreciated. We go to the north Tempe location frequently and it never disappoints. The pear mule is a go-to complete with real pieces of pear in the bottom. They do take reservations, it doesn't usually seem to be necessary but that might change with spring training coming so it's not a bad idea. The decent prices are an added bonus.

oovIO9KoQxgFnA4K7A-Mlw.text: Good light healthy fare  I had the marble ruben  Marble rye bread pulled pork, cheese, and pickles.   I would have preferred more meat but i think they are trying to keep the sandwiches light and fresh.  The sweet potato fries where the best I have ever had.

n6e2fWQNZPqyLHwobcccpw.text: I love this place! Their butternut squash fall salad is amazing! Also love the ambience. Service is good. A bit pricey, but worth it.

Pu2tOCtAyWjqy57P1bWmKA.text: I liked this place a lot! We tried the south of the mountain quesadilla and the red peppers inside were really good. Also the sauce was delish. We also tried the pear tacos - bacon, avocado, and sauce were very good. Lastly happy hour gives you $2 off cocktails so we tried the peach margarita (loved it) and the blueberry mojito.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

WzL_Je1uh4fNzf5n2L9IEw.text: The restaurant is cute with a trendy decor. The waiter took a long time to take the order, so I had to go ask the hostess to get him.  I ordered the quinoa bowl and it was pretty bland and the squash undercooked and the avocado was not ripe.  My mom ordered a sandwich and sweet potato fries . The sandwich looked pretty good and the fries were good.  The waiter took my meal off the bill and gave us a $5 coupon for the next visit.  I am going to give them another chance and try one of their gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches as that looks like that is their speciality.

MlI9gaqaGeqFnDbCdOR05A.text: On business and looked good. Food was great. Staff was friendly.   Would be nice to see some candles on the tables.  Ambiance would be perfect but a very nice place. Would recommend

BmIuqsqlAmkRIwpJFoS4lg.text: A little pricey ( $3 extra for chicken as the protein and $5 for shrimp!). But, if you can get over that, this place is great for an hour's lunch break from work as I've tried it.

F68MVztN1aeQNsZpGr5mMA.text: Dined in and had food to-go at least 6 times and each time has been amazing! My girlfriend and I regularly get the tacos (Carnitas and Pacos Pear), which are loaded with meat and veggies.  If this place just had a better whiskey and Tequila selection, it'd be my regular spot for dine-in.

8YNIvjPt40Cll37b6xEoKQ.text: Had a very nice lunch here! The service was great!  The Beer selection was really good and server was very knowledgeable about the beers so we liked that as we are craft beer people!  The menu had a lot of great choices and we really enjoyed our food.  My son's Mac and Cheese was delicious!  My other son thoroughly enjoyed his chicken club with sweet potato fries.  My husband and I each had the pear cob. His in a salad and mine in a wrap with a side of broccoli salad.  All were yummy. We will definitely be back!

qEDwZU1St6Rx83SPv52Rbg.text: My first time here & really enjoyed the modern rustic decor. The star is the food! I consider myself a foodie & the food did not disappoint! I had the wild chop salad with grilled shrimp. My daughter had creamy butternut rigatoni with added sausage. Yummy to say the least!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Wild Chop Salad w/ Shrimp

cslpEy-0Y0plsBd7KGN2rw.text: I think the 1/2 and 1/2 is a really good deal because their half portions are pretty big and it's 11.50.  Ive never tried anything else but I must figure figure full portions must be gigantic.   Love the chopped salad. I accidently ordered the cobb one instead once but that was good too.  Recommend chopped salad for sure.  My other 1/2 is usually a pasta.  The green Athena (sp) one is good,  mine was very oily though. Still good. My second time I tried the pesto mac. Im a fan of pesto but I didn't get a distinguishing pesto flavor.  I just tasted mac in a cream sauce.   The sandwiches are okay,  I've only tried one off of bfs plate and it was one of the grilled cheese. Good when dipped in tomato soup ;)  I saw a regular sandwich at another table and they look really hearty. I gotta say the accompanying sweet potato fries were bland,   serrated cut but really thick.   The 1/2 soup is not as a great as a portion.  They also differ depending on days but it's a good choice if you're not wanting to get into a food  coma like I did with the pasta/salad.

NL5N2mNPI7evbRyNAhkhyg.text: Solid dishes, nice wine selection.  Kids' Mac and cheese was homemade.  Sweet potato fries were very good.  For a signature dish, the pear salad was sort of disappointing, nothing special really.  Had shishito pepper, hummus, and buffalo cauliflower appetizers.  Solid in each case, but not exceptional.  Reasonable prices.

mFVb6868XKB9wikp8irKfw.text: This place was absolutely fantastic. The food is delicious, the patio is lovely, and the music was subtle but really set the tone.

K24QmBK20mSd1KRjIN-O3A.text: O....M.........G!! Four of us had a delicious meal at this restaurant on Sunday evening. 3 of us had quinoa bowls..........absolutely delicious, and the servings are huge. My husband had a pasta dish.........again, the portion was enormous. We can't wait to come back and bring friends.  Nancy P

XbAHLebBWfNpHELnWZvc8Q.text: My go-to restaurant in Tempe! I love that they offer so many gluten-free substitutes for their dishes! My absolute favorite is the BLTA--their gluten-free bread is soft on the inside but crisp on the outside. It's not dry or grainy (which I find happens a lot with gluten-free breads). They even offer gluten-free noodles for pasta dishes!   They typically serve fries on the side for sandwiches, but I was lucky enough to be informed by our waitress that the fries are cooked in the same oil as their breaded chicken (meaning there was a possibility of cross-contamination). For anyone with celiacs, I would suggest skipping the fries and replacing it with the salad or soup. I got the salad with balsamic, the lettuce was fresh and the sauce added a zesty element (perfect for a hot, summer day).   There is inside and patio seating, I love to sit outside because of their atmosphere. With plenty of misters and plants to keep you cool, you're tucked away in a peaceful grotto. You can tell that all their ingredients are fresh and many of their sauces are housemade. This is the place to go for a healthy and flavorful meal. It's one of my favorite spots if you're gluten-free too!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Carnitas tacos
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Front entrance
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Patio seating

I1EZHdrOpzsakg4J3JNi9A.text: A rare restaurant visit that did not include Larry S.!  My parents had eaten here before and liked it, so it was a good choice on our way to the airport last night (Sky Harbor is about 10 minutes away).   We were greeted by a friendly hostess and initially sat inside, but my dad felt that the AC was a little aggressive, so we moved to the patio. Side note as a Floridian... it IS a dry heat and it is eminently tolerable. You desert dwellers wouldn't last an hour in our swampy steam room down here at the far southern reaches of the US!   My mom and I had a hard time deciding from all of the appealing options. Kudos to them for having a lot of vegetarian choices! My dad went for the Quad City Melt as he'd had it before and liked it. My mom decided on the chicken tacos, side of sweet potato fries, and I had the Mexicali Bowl (quinoa, avocado, roasted butternut squash, cabbage and pepino seeds, served cold). I thought my food was fantastic! Fresh with a hint of spice! We all shared my mom's sweet potato fries, which were excellent. Sometimes s.p. fries can be limp and soggy, but these were perfectly crispy! My folks enjoyed their food very much.   The prices were extremely reasonable given the portion size and food quality, plus the service was friendly and efficient! I had a rather long red-eye flight and I felt totally satisfied while not uncomfortable, so the Perfect Pear was a Perfect Choice for dinner last night!

ta2T6FrxFXydM5XlJy_eKA.text: I liked it so much, I ate here both nights I was in town!  The quinoa bowl had amazing, fresh flavor. I doubled up on the protein with chicken AND shrimp... I know, I live on the edge every single day. :)  The staff were very helpful with selections, and not full of crap like "oh, everything is good". I'm assuming they also have a heavy pour, because after just three drinks, I was feeling the booziness!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Quinoa bowl
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Garden quinoa bowl with protein

sQyMeUZHXXf2SZLQHpUvOw.text: What really sets this place apart are all of the vegetarian options and the cute outdoor patio seating. I have been here a few times now for lunch and they have some unique, interesting options on their menu for foodies like myself. Combinations like butternut squash tacos and all sorts of delicious salads options. Portions are a nice size too.   Service has been great each time I've visited. They have a free parking lot which is rare for places near downtown Tempe. It does get busy during lunchtime. Great spot to come for a nice lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Butternut squash tacos

SNYkYf1PLJgNJishLYob2g.text: Midday lunch was packed inside so I am thankful reservations were made. I can't get over how extremely loud it was inside the restaurant; it honestly felt like I was in a club. Had a difficult time conversing with my lunch guest and that really took away from the experience. I ordered a Cuban sandwich and I was brought a Philly cheesesteak. I looked at the sandwich and thought to myself "hmmmm....I have never seen a Cuban with tomato and mayonnaise." I shook it off and took two bites then realized this was not what I ordered. Without me having to say anything the server came over with a Cuban in hand and apologizing for the mixup. That I did appreciate. I was not overly impressed with the sandwich and I found the pulled pork to be flavorless and had a lot of fat. I did enjoy the shoestring fries. Parking was atrocious, too. Had to find a spot down in the residential area and hike in a few blocks.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cuban sandwich
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon salad
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Philly cheesesteak

JRj7qNvbdaNO_hDWwM1kzA.text: Everyday is a perfect day for bunch at the Perfect Pear Bistro in Tempe!  After a long bike ride my boyfriend and I were starving.  We ordered soup & salad - The Quad City Melt and the Curry-Coconut  Vegetable Soup!  The soup was delicious!  We loved it. Nice curry flavor and full of bite size veggies.   The sandwich was ok.   We also ordered the Cauliflower Nachos which were ok.  The cauliflower was cold and that was disappointing, but otherwise the flavor was delicious.     The atmosphere and service were good.   I recommend you try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Out seating looks beautiful and inviting!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. The bar.
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. The restaurant has plenty of seating!

zGImM2nbrYUfuEx9PHGhxA.text: We came in on a busy weekday prior to our show at Gammage.  It was very busy!  But they sat us at a small table for two quickly, and our food came out very quickly as well.  I ordered their strawberry balsamic quinoa bowl. It was mediocre at best.  It seemed to be premade and that it had been sitting out.  The arugula was sparse and wilted. The strawberries were a bit mealy.  I like the idea of this dish but the execution was lackluster.  When food is premade the taste/quality reflects that.  I would have much preferred a more filling portion with lots of fresh fruit and greens, instead of soggy ones.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

Gqj7SNm3dL41xeKXuqhBiQ.text: Chose the buffalo cauliflower and the black & blue brussel sprouts. Delicious! Service is friendly and good at giving details about the food items.

0ME9ngnFLy5rd_QxUInR5g.text: Oh my!  Perfect Pear Bistro serves up some perfect dishes!  And it's in a cool ambiance with both indoor and outdoor (covered) seating!  We ordered the bacon asparagus grilled cheese sandwich with seasonal cucumber salad, peanut curry quinoa bowl with chicken, and coconut curry soup.  The peanut coconut curry quinoa bowl with chicken was everything wonderful that you have ever dreamed about presented in a large portion size of healthy deliciousness!  I'm not sure that makes a whole lot of sense, but if there's just one menu item that you're going to order, then make it this quinoa bowl!  The bacon and asparagus grilled cheese was very good, although I felt that this grilled cheese sandwich was lacking a little... cheese.  Would have been even better with a more generous portion of cheese on it!  The coconut curry soup was good, but unfortunately it paled in flavor when also having the peanut coconut curry quinoa bowl.  The addition of peanut really adds so much flavor to the quinoa bowl version that the soup would be better ordered alone.  Our server was on top of her game and quick to answer our questions, take our order, and bring out our food and drinks!  Will definitely return!  *****FIVE STARS*****

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Asparagus and bacon grilled cheese! With seasonal cucumber salad!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Peanut coconut curry quinoa bowl with chicken!!

qan_XuLTd-fUP76KjQlYkw.text: How do I go here and not try any of their signature PEAR-ings??? I must've been daydreaming about something else...that something else was none other than the chicken peanut coconut quinoa bowl!!! What a breath full of fresh goodness! Who knew fresh, healthy, good for ur body & soul quinoa bowl could taste like a hot double fudge sundae with blackberry whip cream and jackfruit?!?!   The chicken coconut curry soup and asparagus bacon grilled cheese was just ok compared to the quinoa bowl, hence I'm giving this experience only 4 stars...the soup was overly flavored with turmeric and left a really strong bitter turmeric after taste in ur mouth that's hard to ditch...it was like trying to get rid of an ex that kept coming back...not very pleasant...  The grilled cheese was not really what I was expecting...it could've just been labeled a sandwich since there was not much cheese at all in the so-called grilled cheese, and it was very dry...  The restaurant had a good vibe to it with some cute outdoor seating as well as a cool interior. The hostess that day probably had a rough day, so i will give her a free pass for her inability to smile and her annoyed appearance. Other than that, an overall fun and decent meal with my bae! Definitely will come back for the quinoa bowl!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Asparagus &amp; bacon grilled cheese!!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken coconut curry soup!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Love, happiness,  and food. Can&#39;t go wrong!

lTMmDZFKo4Ms24wU6WBSQw.text: We loved this place! Both iced tea choices were delicious, but my fave is the watermelon black tea. The watermelon is subtle and works really well. Can you tell all I really cared about was the tea!? I'm very picky! Salad was delicious too. Overall enjoyed our lunch on the patio

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating area

h9WEiZCtsq8hEaJfJA8XaQ.text: I've been here a few times. Very unique and fun setting. Really good food and friendly staff. I would definitely recommend the Autumn Roast Quinoa Bowl and Tuscan Rigatoni.

KqXNe_00UKV_WiOSDEcD_g.text: Perfect Pear is a cute little restaurant on University that has a ton of character.  They have a nice patio in the cooler months, but there is still a large dining room with ample room for a busy night.  Word on the street was that the portions were really large, so I opted for the 1/2 salad, soup combo.  It was the perfect amount of food for lunch.  I got the tomato basil soup and the Fall Leaves salad.  The salad was full of toppings; goat cheese, bacon, walnuts, beets, quinoa, and squash.  The tomato soup was thin, but had chunks of tomato and had a rich bold flavor to it.  My dining companions loved their meals.  I was really impressed by the quality of the ingredients and the portion size.  This is my new favorite for lunch in Tempe.

N0e0C9T5pjyQjTAoYUqZkA.text: Always a good experience at Perfect Pear. I had the Green Chili Mac and the bacon on top clinched it. The cheese itself was just right in terms of gooey-ness and spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green Chili Mac with shrimp, yes there&#39;s bacon on top

TzJkSvJNdDB5Jqh4wjm1WA.text: I go here with my coworkers. We really enjoy this place! I like eating healthy and they have so many great tasty options. They have a unique menu with lots of options.  They even have some craft beers on the menu.

zfjee7sp-4oHS9hMDoS7jQ.text: Exceeded expectations!   Tapas plates were a great tasty value.  Pom jalapeno margarita was refreshing.  I had the creamy pasta with bacon peppers and rosemary with chicken was great. Wife had their version of Cuban with sweet tater fries. Loved it. Ohhhhh  Don't forget the pear cobbler!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cobbler!!!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Linguinini
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tapas

4mnCaN32cadzKfc355lf5g.text: Great ambience. We had the cauliflower nachos. We also both got salads. I added the salmon (the portion was a little on the small size) and the wife shrimps. Son got the grilled cheese. All of the food was really good.   They said they get really busy at lunchtime during the week. So just keep that in mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cauliflower nachos
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mediterranean salad -add salmon

v3kstQ421OjlCslPQdHBlA.text: The salad was good, fresh, and interesting ingredients. Honestly all the choices looked good and it was a hard decision.  Weird, you have to wait for a seat outside. Anyway, I expected a tad more complexity to the flavor from the dressing, but to the plus, it wasn't overwhelming. I think kale negates lots of subtle flavors, so that could have had an affect. Like the ambiance and lighting. The service wasn't overbearing or intrusive, which is nice. Would like to try the asparagus soup, but the salad was huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baja Lime salad with shrimp

q7WlTw0zOtTBYxudlIAb1A.text: Absolutely loved this place!!!  The food and service were beyond amazing.  The specialty drinks are even great.  I will definitely be back very soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tuscan pasta with shrimp and Pear Cobb salad
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pear martini

PC4eI8Wi6EWL4q_NXEFzHA.text: Perfect Pear Bistro was ... well .. perfect! Delicious food and a great atmosphere! They have daily happy hour from 11am - 6pm that includes great drink prices and a fun tapas menu. The menu is a mixture of healthy options and comfort food, so it's really great for anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Autumn Quinoa Bowl with Salmon ... amazing!

XDg_UlR-2m41HZQBGV66Nw.text: Great healthy food options! They have salads, wraps, sandwiches, soups and so much more. Good for lunch or casual date. Excellent house salad. Loved the Cuban Sandwich. Fun atmosphere with beautiful outdoor seating. Fast service.

PeTYeZB7ZJrpVHS79rOQsg.text: The Perfect Pear is the perfect dare.   I got pacos pear tacos and they tasted like a rainbow of flavor. Seriously the perfect summer choice!   I didn't have the chance to get a beer off of their happy hour but it's probably one of the best deals in Phoenix. If my memory serves me right it is about 3.25 a glass.   I can't wait to return.

4wCyhMHcPQV9hw4xm9dLgg.text: First visit here on a recommendation and have to say OMG.  Menu is amazing and the food is even more amazing. Everything is fresh and tasty.  I can't wait to come and try another dish.

5unrGFqHvfxJZytjE9oStQ.text: I had never heard of this place until twice in one week so I figured I've gotta try it.   My friend and I met for happy hour and were immediately seated on their cute patio. The red sangria was amazing. Also, do yourself a favor and order the jalapeno & bacon grilled cheese. You know you want to. It's worth it. You earned it.  We will be back!

fTrADUosXcVh4rqtqKW93g.text: This review is just for happy hour.... the drinks here are.....not so great. The happy hour pricing is decent, but the drinks just taste like fake flavored vodkas. We tried the brie with bacon and it was tasty, but that's hard to mess up. For Mill area, Perfect Pear isn't bad, but otherwise, it isn't a place I'd go for HH.

TfAoeCmfdmyl_qfI6HDAnQ.text: Love love love this restaurant! Went on a bumble bff date here and had the greatest time for happy hour. The cauliflower nachos were to die for as well as the pear mule! Would definitely go again. My bumble bff friend and I may even go there again together

psAgRgZEqJ4ilGuoyxivvQ.text: Went to perfect pear because it was so close to gammage.  It was so good and very nice atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.

dEzTH-bez0YQMvrT0uDLGA.text: Yummy but pricey. We came for Happy Hour so the prices were reasonable. The butternut squash pasta was delicious- we nearly licked the plate. My cocktail was also great. We'll be back, but only for HH!

Pkr7WA9m0efZatgYL5s_Xg.text: I was visiting my hometown of Phoenix with my brother abd uncle and to pass the time on current ongoing traffic we stopped here to satisfy our dinner time cravings. I ordered the B.L.T with avocado and it was such a delicious sandwich I would try again. Waitress was kind as well as gorgeous. By the end of our meal I was deeply satisfied; taste buds amazed. This is just of many original restaurants I have yet to re-discover since I moved from Phoenix to Naperville, Illinois, and I have not had In-N-Out Burger in almost 12 years!

QhSmaLbL6KnM5yHNxE7ntQ.text: I can't say there is much to recommend this place except that they offer a choice of kale or no kale in their salad mix. Seriously, the food is bleh and the ambiance, which could be good given the setting, is unappealing. The service was okay, but not a place I'd bother to return to.

1jm0Lbe_bT-o0NVByQYREQ.text: Came for lunch and they have a bunch of great grilled cheese options and were playing tame impala 10/10 would recommend

SUX5JB4zlwm-6dsPc_aJ0w.text: From out of town with a group of co-workers.  We each had salads with chicken added.  The salads were fresh and beyond excellent! The spinach dip was pretty tasty as well.  Prompt and courteous service too!

CiHt26rVThXSjgL7IVSroQ.text: I have found my oasis for refueling not only  the body but my soul! The ambience was uplifting, tranquil, gorgeous! The servers and the hosts were so polite and cheerful it was a fantastic experience!  And the food! Oh my goodness  The Buffalo Chicken Tacos with cilantro cabbage and southwestern cream sauce-so great! Served with southwest black beans. A delicious combination!  The Spinach Dip should not be overlooked it's a must! The tortilla chips come out hot -perfectly salty and are amazing with the dip in a sour dough bread bowl that you will have a hard time holding yourself back from eating.  I want to come back again and again!

uKtFCn0setzGTdPtK69dAQ.text: I have enjoyed everything I've tried. The roasted sprout is by far my favorite salad. The spinach dip was a hit among the table. Actually EVERYTHING we've had here has been amazing. I've introduced this place to a few of my people and has now become a favorite. There isn't anything on the menu that isn't great. The staff is good depending on the night. I've had a night where are server just wasn't having it even though we were basically the only table, outside of that by far my favorite joint.

iTgd_q3NmQorL0jmUiOdTQ.text: Every time we come, we come back!!! Great food, cool atmosphere! Such a wide selection of good healthy food.

gM5iSPAvQoZq4P7j2yAjBw.text: We went here for lunch yesterday and the place is really cute, as others have mentioned.  Everyone in our party commented on how cute it was.  Everyone but me ordered a salad (and I ordered first... awkward...).  I ordered the mac and cheese which was ok.  Sauce was kind of runny but had decent flavor.  Not the best mac and cheese I've had but also not the worst.  I'd definitely try something different next time but will visit again for sure.

4xwigKTUCOTajzn3io5VvQ.text: This place is awesome,  has this cute little hip and rustic feel. Awesome beer selection, super diverse menu.  Servers are super sweet.  Will make this a regular spot!

osQe2Wndta8ezugvoF_Sxw.text: This place is fantastic! It has plenty of parking and is fare enough away from Mill Ave to have a quite and more relaxing meal.  With plenty of delicious food options and an amazing happy hour, this place is a must try.  Their drink selection has plenty of local favorite and they have a nice list of custom cocktails. They have a great outdoor patio/courtyard, wonderful intimate indoor seating and with a nice bar to cozy up to.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Athena&#39;s Garden Pasta!
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

1xmPddpnu1nX3srmXuA4aQ.text: I ate here for my first time about a month ago and I was pleasantly surprised with their menu and how good everything sounded! It is very unique and not like anywhere around the area (I've eaten my way through Tempe it feels like). We are on the covered outdoor patio which was a very cute area with beautiful lights! The server helped us select a beer by giving us samples of the ones we were in between and did not seem at all impatient while we decided. The service was very prompt and pleasant.   The salads are very fresh and mixed/prepared well and they had a great pasta selection too! We did the half soup, half salad which was a great portion size. The pasta was a little bland and I expected more as far as flavor, but this would be the only reason I did not give them the full 5 stars!  I would definitely eat here again and would recommend this to my friends.

IJV3kYkanrJHuqFdtF41TQ.text: Love this place! I ordered the shrimp spicy Cobb salad & it was so good & fresh! I'll sure to recommend this place to anyone who enjoys good food like I do! & service was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

VVPinVx-ASxuxFdnHzO0Fg.text: Been here a couple of times in the past, and literally everything on their menu is fantastic. We went on Saturday for dinner, and we got their signature Perfectly Grilled Cheese (brie, four cheese, arugula, bacon) with the house salad side and the Sicilian Sandwich (sirloin, red peppers, tomatoes, arugula) with their seasonal side. When we went, the side was a broccoli slaw, and I just wanted to keep eating the broccoli; it was absolutely delicious.   Their grilled cheese options make the perfect comfort food for any time of day, and they give you a nice portion of food. Same with the Sicilian Sandwich; the sirloin goes down so smoothly, the meal will be over before you know it!

sRWQUUDRrcFFfjl_6TtcZg.text: Loved the butternut squash tacos. Unique and delicious. Pair with the Pear Mule and Calliflower Nachos

FkZUDUj5GBxWqcArA3Ddag.text: Great experience. Super friendly staff. Loved, loved my root salad. I really like how you can pick your " lettuce base " and protein for each salad. Will definitely come back. Very happy to find a  healthy restaurant in Tempe.

34EOHBPDdQ-MZ5vkaMGAaQ.text: I ordered Banh Mi sandwich. It wasn't good. The bread was old and cold. The pork had no flavor. I can get a better sandwich than that somewhere else at a cheaper price. I don't recommend ordering it. Their sweet potato was ok. They don't do half sandwich and salad here. They said you can upgrade your order to add salads in which will add more cost to your order.

BNXHj3gNzrpU56_SOed68w.text: loved this place! service and food were perfect. Cocktail was yummy and strong too! they had creative dishes and healthy options as well. the ambience was hip and friendly. will be returning

KYncwenC3144eOX71E0NHA.text: I absolutely love the Perfect Pear Bistro!  The atmosphere is awesome, the patio is a great spot when the weather permits, and the staff is friendly.  I've tried something from almost every section of the menu and I have not been disappointed. The salads are fresh, the grilled cheeses are unique, the sandwiches have some really great bread choices, and the tacos are SO GOOD.   One of the best things Pear has to offer is the selection of refreshing cocktails. I've tried most of the signature drinks and they're all delicious. Nike makes a mean mojito!  This is one of my favorite spots in Tempe!

qCE2t4iRoY2SFp3w7LUeow.text: Found this place through Yelp. Great customer service and friendly staff. Had hard choice between a Benny but I went with the Esalvadorian Breakfast which was unique dish I had never tried. My husband got the Korean Bulgogi Benny along with French toast.  Flavor was good for all dishes though my husband is not a fan of banana flavor in his French toast he still ate most of the dish. Would come back.

RxsNG9stqew64B_pUciEnQ.text: The service and food here are excellent. I really like the atmosphere of the restaurant. The parking can get a bit tricky, however - so be warned.

1jLGLBGxzthJbijqI9WYXg.text: 1 server for the entire inside dining room. 2 6 tops open and the manager refused to break one down for our party of two. At least 3 parties of two were seated at 4 tops. A waste.

K8tdI40kxTU3q4I1QAaY_g.text: I think Perfect Pear Bistro is so cute and fun! After looking at the menu online, it was easy for my family to agree on this restaurant. It is affordable and they offer a great selection of foods... I'm talking anywhere from pasta to tacos. It was a Saturday afternoon, not very busy, and our server was pretty on top of things!  I've been here several times and I don't think the food is the most amazing thing, but it definitely is tasty. The staff, accessibility, ambiance, and reasonable prices keep me coming back. Since I haven't found a menu item that I'm CRAZY about yet, I got a little creative with what I ordered. I asked for the chicken pesto sandwich but in form of a wrap with spinach and other greens bundled inside. VERY tasty. Loved the fact that they were able to make this accommodation for me. I have now found my new favorite thing and will continue comin' back for it!   Give Perfect Pear a try if you're looking for a quick, nice lunch or dinner fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Created my own wrap from their chicken pesto sandwich!

MO43KbUgnGn5Tn8DMzSxFA.text: Their menu is very extensive, something for everyone . The salads are big and very flavorful. Loved their dressings. A must try if you are close to ASU

8woqXlr2ie7hffMJdXGZJg.text: My boyfriend and I sat outside and had a lovely meal. The misters were peaceful as well as the ambiance. We ordered blueberry beers (recommend) as well at the pesto goat cheese and olives with crostini to start. Wow! The goat cheese and olives were so flavorful. Next we ordered the Cuban with half sweet potato fries half regular fries and the Jalapeno grilled cheese with tomato soup. Wow! Again so much flavor! I was really blown away by the food and menu options. The perfect pear was perfect!

9CMcv7-APmml0-mS3WyD5A.text: This place just opened...what a hidden gem.   Met some of my friends here for girls night. We ordered the sangria (red and white) we all loved it. I personally got the white and it tasted just like juice. So awesome!   The spinach artichoke comes in a bread bowl, what?! Sooooo good! We were pulling pieces of bread out of the bowl once we were done because it was that good! I definitely recommend it.   If you've seen any of my other reviews you know I LOVE chipotle sauce. Perfect Pear has chipotle cream rigatoni and it will change your life, haha. No, but really, it's super delicious. Not too spicy at all! Definitely enough for lunch tomorrow as well. Two meals in one, score!!   The atmosphere is super cute and modern. I don't suggest bringing little ones here, I know mine would have had a hard time there not breaking things lol.  Definitely recommend bringing a date or an out-of-towner here! What a cute spot! Can't wait to go back!!   Try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle rigatoni! 5 stars!!!

_pJ4Wfm6PR8n1r2Lc0ihRg.text: Charming patio and the perfect spot to please everyone. Meat eaters can add protein to bowls, salads, and pasta. Vegetarians can leave the food as is.  I had the lemon linguini with asparagus, tomatoes, and broccoli - added salmon. I did the combo, so also added the Sprouts salad with roasted Brussels sprouts, pepitas, feta, and pesto vinaigrette. Paired with happy hour La Playa Sauvignon Blanc, it was perfect.  Friendly and attentive service. Reasonable prices for quality food with fresh ingredients and some fun, trendy twists.  Great spot for post-theatre at Gammage - they offer a discount with your same-day ticket stub.  I'll definitely be back when I'm in Tempe.

0HoA2lYjkxRH_j0HKLHXdA.text: This place is in the top 5 favorites.  My friend and I meet once a month for lunch and this was our first visit.  We will be back!  Thank you, yum!

wA7VGN_LOaeXfaWziB4A1A.text: Amazing service. Liz, our waitress, was kind and attentive. Food was quickly delivered and full of flavor. Reasonably priced and excellent atmosphere. Highly recommend!

-wySYoARPAhlc6KPKUvrUg.text: They have an amazing menu, it was very hard to decide what eat! Everything looked good. I ended up with the mushroom melt and a bowl of shrimp and corn chowder. It was a bit cold inside, I was already wearing a cardigan, and our server was wearing a more heavy sweater. She gave us good service and kept checking in on us. We were there at 11:30a on a Sat and it was perfect timing before the lunch crowd came in (we were the only ones there for a bit) the food around us looked good too, a hummus plate, and the salads!!! The patio is super cute but it was way to cold lol

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

4GkunWLHDbmzuld532Fyjw.text: Sorry perfect pair. I wanted to like you, and there were some redeeming factors, but overall it was a miss. My friend has a gluten allergy so this seemed like a great place since they offer gf bread and pasta. I felt like being sympathetic so I also ordered a gluten free choice.  She had the jalapeno grilled cheese and I had the bacon mac.  Both entrees were very bland and uninspired in my humble opinion.    The pros are that the atmosphere is really charming and we really enjoyed the wine we ordered.  Our server was friendly and attentive as well; too bad about the food though.

tCWnyPTwAOreVD6yF_5WpQ.text: Loved our first-time lunch there!  Food was fresh, service was friendly and efficient, atmosphere was charming.   What's not to like about that?    Paco's Pear Tacos were yummy and super fresh - very good experience!

qgIyoc2FlvO9ZnQdKM5gGg.text: What an amazing bistro! The staff is kind and attentive, the food is worth every bite, and their only dessert is the best cobbler I've ever had! We did the soup combo: mushroom & Brie soup with the Baja lime salad. My fiance got the green chili with creamy mushroom Marsala.   Everything finger licking delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

RZ6zHBGMARPKZlz9-Gb3IQ.text: Hummus plate ordered with special request for "strictly gluten free ", friendly waitress expressed understanding of avoiding cross contamination etc., then dish came out from the kitchen with an accidental dusting of wheat bread crumbs indicating the dish had been assembled with its usual wheat bread accompaniment on the plate and then the bread was grabbed and taken off leaving crumbs behind. This restaurant states they offer gluten-free items. If they cannot provide consistent delivery of those items being truly gluten-free that should be effectively communicated to customers on the menu so people can make informed decisions.

2_h8I-tmC7Ec0BoKbBqNvg.text: Very nice atmosphere. Excellent selection of beers. Had the poblano pepper soup. It had great flavor; well balanced cream soup with a mild spice to it. Had the paco's pear tacos. It was underwhelming. The chicken was not well seasoned and the sauce is not flavorful. Flavors were overpowered by the bacon. The avocado did not provide much for the taco. Would have been better to make it into a guacamole instead. Service was good. Would come back and try something else

udT8E4tvJdaVpUPSXyDxLA.text: Was in the area and decided to give this place a try. Cute little lunch spot. The food is pretty good. I had a quinoa bowl with coconut curry and i was happy with it. Service is quick and decent. I'll definitely be back for more salads/grain bowls. Yummm!

D6NUE5zFiirTZ7lZQxAeLQ.text: Loved the ambiance, but both sandwiches we had (Chicken club and French pantry) had an awful lot of bread. Sweet potato fries and service were awesome.

Zoqd-ZsTXtv04iv3TPS88w.text: I have come to this Perfect Pear Bistro location on several different occasions - even bringing friends and family from out of town to show them one of my favorite spots. I've always had great service and amazing food. Today was like any other day except when I walked the waitress asked if we wanted to sit indoors or out followed by " there's trash everywhere so it's limited". I looked around to see 10 dirty tables outside (and even more inside!!)With only two sets of customers. There was another waitress inside on her phone and another waiter inside fiddling with his beard and mustache. The bistro wasn't busy, and completely filthy. It took 30 min for them to even begin clearing off a table. And throughout our whole dining experience only 1 of 10 was completed, and we were here for over an hour and a half. Very disappointing that one of my favorite places was so filthy.

j3HGGKCadEmT0doA6nQnlQ.text: Looking for excellent food at reasonable prices, coupled with super service, the Perfect Pear Bistro is for you.  Visiting from out of state, staying at a hotel near the airport we were looking for something good, light and reasonable.  The Perfect Pear is for you.  Recommendation to go with the "Pear Two".  I had the Acorn Squash Rigatoni, paired with the Pear Cobb Salad.  Absolutely delicious.  Flavorful, excellent portions. We started with spinach dip, again, delicious and flavorful.  Excellent selection of craft beers.  Nike was our server, very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  Again,  highly recommended you will not be disappointed.

6BwfpT14pxd-DD3Zh68IaQ.text: Nice establishment with great patio seating and friendly staff. I would rate the food a 3.5/5, but the dining experience is why I give it a 4/5. Good looking menu but maybe a tad too many options. We got the Brussels sprouts salad and the BLT with iced green teas, the salad was good but nothing amazing and the BLT was ok, we weren't fans of the bread of the type of bacon they use. Sweet potato fries are delicious! The iced green tea was so nice and they even give you a cup to go, which was a great touch. Would go again to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Best iced green tea
Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout salad.

ff7fLWt_Iuss24oZyGdqHA.text: We stopped here by happenstance on the way home from the airport, because I was starving and traffic was just not moving.  They have a tranquil patio that is also dog friendly.  I fully enjoyed the mushroom grilled cheese and a giant "side-salad".   For my dog, I requested a grilled chicken breast. It has been the best $3.99 that I've spent in a long time. He wolfed it down so quickly that I only got a picture of him and an empty plate!  As there were many other dishes on the menu that I would have liked to try, I'll just have to visit again.

jFb-h3-3LiRJ64Ch_G43Zg.text: Perfect Pear Bistro...Not so perfect, at least on the day we had lunch.  I was underwhelmed after I had so many people I know rave about the place.  I went with 2 co-workers to celebrate one of their birthdays.  None of us had been before & we were really looking forward to trying it out.  We got there right when they opened...got a nice table with a nice server.  Many unique menu options to choose from...I decided on the Asparagus & Bacon Grilled Cheese with the Tomato/Basil Soup.  I don't like Rye so I asked the waitress for a substitute bread suggestion.  She recommended Ciabatta...done.  Birthday girl ordered tacos & a side of black beans.  Our co-worker finally decided, after much debate, on the Perfectly Grilled Cheese sandwich & soup ( I think it was Asparagus Soup).  The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time.  Birthday girl grabs her silverware only to find out it's filthy. It's coated in something dark reddish brown & crusty...Strike #1.  My other co-worker is kind of in disbelief when she looked at her Perfectly Grilled Cheese sandwich...It was totally burnt...black.  Knowing the Pear Bread it comes with is covered in sugar it makes sense it would carmalize, but this thing looked like it caught on fire.  Again debating on whether to send it back or not she decided to keep it & had to scrape off as much of the burnt areas as she could because we were on our lunch hour...Strike #2.  My food was a total disappointment...I realized right away Ciabatta was not a good recommendation for my sandwich.  It didn't allow the cheese to properly melt & it was just luke warm.  It was also kind if thick for the sandwich...Strike #3.  The most disappointing had to be the Tomato/Basil Soup.  The flavor just wasn't there & it was covered in what looked to be floating puddles of oil.  I'm no expert but I've had Tomato/Basil soup many times in my lifetime & this greasy looking soup was a first... Strike #4.  I would have given this review 2 stars if it wasn't for the delicious Pear Cobbler.  That was the standout star of the meal & if it hadn't been for the fact we we're celebrating a birthday we would have missed it altogether...My friends both said their food was okay, but its not someplace they feel like they want to go back to anytime soon...My food kind of made this a one & done for me.

ECgsk0NrN_734-UnC_UZIA.text: Read the reviews and tried it. Great service!  Had the strawberry salad which was delicious.  A bit small for the price though.....Also the jalapeno grilled cheese was yummy.  We'll be back!!

XZE7iDcxp7QO43k2G5VkpQ.text: Needed a quick stop to fuel up and this really hit the spot.   The environment was very pleasant with great outdoor seating!   Menu was very expansive and allowed you to mix and match some of the options to get the perfect "pear".   The ingredients were very fresh and complimented the dishes well.   Our party stayed mainly on the salads and the pastas and all enjoyed their selection.

V1Rphe7Iyo1Br2VuJT34bg.text: Was pretty good and I liked the ambiance. I got a quinoa bowl and I agree with a few other peeps, it was pretty greasy so you don't want to eat the bottom part. I want to try the wraps or tacos

MGx-e2SP3snlbrGDXMVYWg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in the valley! Everything I've had here is delicious. The half salad and half pasta combo is the best. Any of their salads are delicious. Try them as a wrap with sweet potato fries and ranch on the side... so good! The buffalo cauliflower app is wonderful and so are the Greek nachos. A lot of vegetarian options too which is really awesome.

MJrT_2zHQKvg5nXWqDeSVA.text: My coworkers and I love Perfect Pear. The portions are generous and the fresh ingredients are great for lunch (never been for dinner). Order the Brussel Sprouts appetizer! I love their Autumn Roast Quinoa Bowl, the pastas are great and their sweet potato fries are ammmaaazzziiiinnnggg! Get there early for lunch because they get super busy

epjp7sWq5iEBVPOz8zjIAQ.text: Incredible! Don't pass this place up! We had the buffalo chicken tacos and carnitas tacos--amazing and flavorful! Even the iced tea was delicious. Wish we were local and could try more. Thanks!

4B3-oLkmxYRW4trx6eHaBA.text: Went there yesterday. Got a quinoa bowl. It was amazing!! Going to try to recreate it myself  that's how good it was!

BnHBxkyOSBuijBkYWpPqJQ.text: Superb imitate and romantic Tempe restaurant in a beautiful building away from the chaos of Mill: fresh food, strong drinks, super chill staff (shauna & mitch made me feel like I was at home), and terrific music to transport you from the day's ills. Added plus are local fresh ingredients, 90% local beers, & local liquor (including local Commerce Gin). So support local; support Perfect.

0tEwOlVstunWXJk9y8TYIw.text: Got take out from here when I was staying at a hotel nearby. Omgggg!  I got the 1/2 pasta 1/2 salad with the fall salad and the rigatoni butternut squash pasta. The portions were huge!!!  Everything was fresh and amazing!  All that for only $14. The ambiance looked super charming and I can't wait to go back and dine in. Highly recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Perfect Pear Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

SNW1cC6oX8DsyZ7VH7p6nQ.text: Stawberry Fields salad is so good!!! I am limited in what I can eat, but the menu looks amazing!

4EyuqEXRcT_5Cs9rMoWYDg.text: Found this place on Yelp and thought I 'd give it a try after reading all the good reviews.  I showed up on a Saturday night at 8ish and saw the place was mostly empty.  Service was quick and friendly.  I got the chicken pesto sandwich with a side salad.  The side salad was actually pretty large but it cost an extra $3 over the fries.  The chicken sandwich was really good.  The place is a little hipster for my liking but the food is good...I guess I should expect that for a restaurant near a college campus.  I'd probably eat here again.

VUSW4XuY_nwM2l9tG95_GQ.text: I really enjoyed this place. We were seated immediately and the patio is lovely. Enough to get sunshine and enjoy the fresh air, but nicely covered so you're not scorched by the sun. The food was really good! I tried the Chicken Club and it was very flavorful and the sweet potato fries were crispy. The happy hour is nice too since it's daily. Would definitely recommend for a lunch out.

TKRH7OufGsrRd8wXYI1U8w.text: called in a grilled cheese for takeout. it  didn't disappoint the food was great! the 9 grain bread was delicious so were the french fries. i'll definitely be back

AEJi2tUNzZXDysRhOiZuqw.text: Great fresh and delicious food. I was very happy that they have selection of gluten free dishes. Will come by on my next trip or passing thru Phoenix.

3E2vM4vkBYsIK_DQhc1etw.text: Food is alright. Nothing special. Service was EXTREMELY slow and our waitress was not friendly at all. My main complaint/concern is that the patio is overrun with bees. Customers were standing up from their tables to avoid them and trying to kill them. Told our waitress that bees literally flew into our food and water and she disregarded our comments and responded saying yeah the bees are pretty much everywhere here. Owners/management need to do something about the bee problem ASAP. Most likely will not return.

Ug8kSORjER5SuvEozVZ3YA.text: Great menu, wonderful service! This PPB is close to my wife's work so the 1st time was after I picked her up from work and we were looking for someplace different to go for dinner. Glad we came here instead of Oregano's which was in the next block. We both have had something different each trip. Can't say enough about how healthy the food choices are. Now with two other locations we'll be bringing our friends to PPB for our monthly chow down!

4qh8U-6dsz_QkmYjOnShFQ.text: We went for an early dinner with our 3 kids, ages 3,6, 9. Kids menu is good. We had guacamole and buffalo cauliflower. Both were delicious! Mediterranean salad was delicious and large. My husband had the mushroom melt and loved it. Grapefruit shandy beer was also yummy! Great ambiance, highly recommend this restaurant.

X1q-ArUraflZ8j4Dkjap5Q.text: I've had extremely good salads here. The salad dressings were especially great. I love the atmosphere and the shaded patio seating. The servers are friendly, too.

PdUDCuS9MW0ZXr1xnISCfw.text: Came here for our first time tonight and couldn't be more pleased! We ordered the mini hummus and cucumbers off the happy hour menu- super good and just enough to tide us over until our friend arrived and we ordered. For our drinks we ordered the Pear Mule, Peach Margarita and Pear Martini! Excellent!!!  For dinner we chose to all share the Hummus Nachos, the Buffalo Chicken Tacos and the Perfectly Grilled Cheese with French fries and Sweet Potato fries. Starting with the Hummus Nachos- not one bad thing to say about this! It's huge- definitely a sharing size, crisp chips, excellent fresh ingredients and delicious Hummus! The Perfectly Grilled Cheese was absolutely incredible, our favorite out of the 3! The bread we would have bought a loaf of, the cheese combination is the best!! And last but certainly not least the Buffalo Chicken Tacos! So very good! The chicken was flavorful, the slaw on top was fresh and delicious!! Overall it was an excellent experience!! We will definitely be back here!!

k_3aBr6wfPi38hmJZuHnoQ.text: Really enjoyed drinks here last night. The pear martini is wonderful, not too sweet, very fresh tasting.  The appetizers were good too although they wouldn't let you order happy hour tapas (even at a higher price) when it wasn't happy hour so that cut the appetizer list down. Overall service was good too.  The only critique I have is that the outside patio area is really blah, awful metal chairs and bright lights, the inside is quite comfortable though. I'll definitely go back for the Pear martinis and flatbread.

TvmTzUBUAH09PDoQbsFHlg.text: I've been coming here with my family since the grand opening and I've always loved the place and  gotten the same dish. Tonight my family and I came in for our weekly family dinner and ended up wasting money and going home hungry. Tonight I received that same dish and It was served to me watered down and completely different. I rarely do this but I ended up a sending it back and I asked to bring it out in a to go box since my family had already eaten. I received it in a to go box exactly the way I sent it back. Cold, different and gross....although this time the water was drained from the pasta. Any idiot could see it was the same garbage I had just sent back. Anyway. I'm super bummed to say that I won't be coming here anymore. You couldn't fix my food and my wife couldn't even get the beer she wanted or a drink that didn't taste like cough medicine. Food sucked. Service was aaaiiiiight, and the ability to think quick and resolve a problem was completely absent. Bummed out and wasted money.

PQy7XzxjuTtvlZjoJCS_Mw.text: Go to this restaurant asap. It's a great spot with seriously good food, and could use the support of the neighborhood. You won't be disappointed!
